src: اتأكد أن ايدك مسترخية على قد ما تقدر واستمر في ضرب كل النغمات بطريقة صحيحة، وحاول بردو متقومش بحركات غريبة بصوابعك. بالطريقة دي مش هتحتاج تبذل مجهود كبير. وتذكر إنه مش لازم تضغط على المفاتيح بقوة كبيرة عشان تحصل على مستوى صوت أعلى زي البيانو. في الأكورديون، عشان تاخد صوت أعلى إضافي، ممكن تستعمل المنفاخ بس بضغط أو سرعة كبيرة.
mt: Make sure your fingers are relaxed as much as possible and continue to strike all the notes correctly, and try not to make any strange movements with your fingertips. This way you won't have to exert much effort. And remember that you don't have to press the keys very hard to get a louder sound than the piano. To get an additional higher sound, you can use the bellows, but only with a lot of pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: من المشاكل المنتشرة لما بتحاول تحويل فيلم إلى تنسيق DVD هو المسح الضوئي الزائد. أجهزة التلفاز معظمها بتتصنع بطريقة ترضي غالبية الجمهور. عشان كده تلاقي كل حاجة معروضة على شاشة التلفاز مقطوعة من الحواف، من الأعلى والأسفل و الجانبين. دا اتعمل عشان يتاكدوا أن الصورة بتغطي الشاشة كلها. ودا بيسموه بالتجزئة العالية. لسوء الحظ، مرجح أنه يتم قطع حدود قرص DVD عند إنشاؤه، ولو كان الفيديو فيه ترجمات قريبة أوي من الجزء السفلي، فهي مش هتتعرض بالكامل.
mt: One of the common problems when trying to convert a film to DVD format is overscan. Most TVs are manufactured to satisfy the majority of viewers. As a result, everything on the TV screen is cropped from the top, bottom, and sides. This is done to ensure that the picture covers the entire screen. Unfortunately, it is likely that the DVD is cropped when it is created, and if the video had subtitles close to the bottom, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: الخطة الأمريكية كانت بتعتمد أنهم يعملوا هجمات منظمة من 3 جهات. الجنرال جون كادوالادر ممكن يبدأ هجوم عشان يشتت الانتباه ضد الحامية البريطانية في بوردينتاون عشان يمنع أي تعزيزات. الجنرال جيمس أوينج هياخد 700 عنصر منتمي للمليشيا عن طريق النهر في عبارة ترينتون، ويحتل الجسر فوق خليج أسونبينك، وهيمنع أي قوات معادية من أنها تهرب. قوة الهجوم الرئيسية، اللي بتتكون من 2,400 رجل، كانت هتعبر النهر اللي موجود على بعد تسعة أميال شمال ترينتون، وبعد كده تتقسم لمجموعتين، الأولى بيقودها غرين والثانية بيقودها سوليفان، عشان إطلاق هجوم قبل الفجر.
mt: The American plan was to conduct a three-pronged attack. General John Cadwalader would begin the attack to divert the British attention from the British garrison at Bordentown to prevent any reinforcements. General James Sullivan would take 700 militia across the river in the transport ship Trenton, capture the bridge over Assunpink Creek, and prevent any enemy from escaping. The main attack force, consisting of 2,400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one led by Greene and the other by Sullivan, to launch the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "بعد ما الكونجرس نبه في 4 يوليو إن فيه مسودة مكتوبة بخط الايد ممضية من رئيس الكونجرس جون هانكوك وأمين السر تشارلز طومسون على بعد البعض من الأبنية اتبعتت إلى مطبعة جون دونلاب. في الليل اتعمل ما بين 150 و200 نسخة، معروفة دلوقتي باسم ""نشرات دنلاب النقدية"". أول قراءة عامة للوثيقة كانت عن طريق جون نيكسون في قاعة الاستقلال في يوم تمانية يوليو. واحدة منهم اتبعتت إلى جورج واشنطن في ستة يوليو، وقد قرأها على قواته في نيويورك في تسعة يوليو. ووصلت نسخة منها إلى لندن في عشرة أغسطس. تمثل مطويات دنلاب الخمسة وعشرين أقدم النسخ اللي باقية من مستند إعلان الاستقلال الأمريكي، ولكن النسخة الأصلية المكتوبة بخط اليد منجتش."
mt: "After the Congress noted on July 4 that there was a handwritten draft passing between House Speaker John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson a few yards from the buildings followed to John Dunlap's print shop. In the evening, between 150 and 200 copies were made, known today as "Dunlap Broadside." The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the Independence Hall on July 8. One of them was sent to George Washington on July 6, and he read it to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. Dunlap's twenty-five folds represent the oldest surviving copies of the American Declaration of Independence, but the original handwritten draft was destroyed."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: المستعمرين، اللي شافوا هذا النشاط، طلبوا تعزيزات. تعزيزات المواقع الأمامية لكتيبتي نيوهامبشير الأولى والثالثة ضمت في صفوفه 200 رجل بيقودهم العقيد چون ستارك والعقيد چيمس ريد (واللي بعدها بقوا جنرالين). رجال ستارك اتمركزوا في مواقع بطول السياج من الطرف الشمالي حتى مكان المستعمر. لما الجزرفتح فجوة على طول نهرميستيك على طول الجانب الشمالي الشرقي من شبه الجزيرة ، قاموا بسرعة بتوسيع السور بجدار حجري قصير إلى الشمال بينتهي عند حافة الميه على شاطئ صغير. حط جريدلي أو ستارك وتد على بعد تقريبا 100 قدم (30 متر) قدام السياج وأمر أن محدش يضرب نار عشان يعديه ضباط الجيش.
mt: The settlers, who saw this activity, requested reinforcements. Reinforcements to the forward positions of the First and Third New Hampshire regiments, which included 200 men led by Colonel John Stark and Colonel James Reed (who later became generals). Stark's men were stationed along the northern side of the wall from the northernmost point to the site of the settlers. When the peninsula opened a gap along the northern edge of the Mystic River, they quickly extended the wall with a short stone wall to the north, ending at the water's edge on a small beach. They placed Stark's palisade and trench about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the wall and ordered no one to light fires so that the soldiers could advance, under the command of the officers.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: الصين القديمة كان عندها طريقة ملهاش مثيل وسبحان الله بيشيروا للفترات معينة في التاريخ؛ هم بيشيروا لكل فترات الصين أو كل أسرة كانت في السلطة كانت عبارة عن نوع مختلف. كان في فترة برده غير مستقرة مع تقسيم المقاطعات بين كل أسرة. وكان أشهر هذه الفترات حقبة الممالك التلاتة، اللي فضلت 60 سنة بين أسرة هان وسلالة جين. خلال الفترات دي قامت حرب قوية بين نبلا كتير كانوا عايزين يوصلوا للعرش. فترة الممالك التلاتة هي واحدة من أكتر الفترات اللي فيها دم في تاريخ الصين القديمة مات آلاف من الناس خلال القتال عشان الجلوس على أعلى المقاعد في القصر الكبير في شيان.
mt: The Chinese ancient had a system without equal and God be praised they referred to certain periods in history; they referred to all periods of China or all dynasties that were in power were of a different type. There was a period of the Three Kingdoms, which preferred 60 years between the Han dynasty and the Jin dynasty. During these periods, a strong war took place between many nobles who wanted to reach the throne. The period of the Three Kingdoms is one of the most periods in which the blood of thousands of people died in the Chinese ancient history to sit on the highest seats in the Great Palace in Xian.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: مستعمرات النمل العسكري بتقدر تمشي وتبني عشش في مراحل مختلفة برده. في فترة البداوة، جيوش النمل بتمشي في الليل وبتتوقف عشان العسكرة في النهار. المستعمرة بتبتدى مرحلة الترحال لما الأكل المتاح يقل. في المرحلة دي بتبني المستعمرة عشش مؤقتة بتتغير كل يوم. كل الاقتحامات أو المسيرات اللي بيقوم بيها البدو الرحالة فضلت حوالي 17 يوم.
mt: Ant colonies can move and build nests in different stages at the same time. In the nomadic stage, the army ants march at night and stop to nest during the day. The colony begins the migratory stage when the available food decreases. In this stage, the nomadic colony builds temporary nests that change every day. All the raids or marches that the nomadic tribe performs are approximately 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: كتير من الإيقاعات اللي بتترصد في علم وظائف الأعضاء والسلوك بتعتمد بشكل كبير في أوقات كتيرة على وجود دورات ذاتية وإنتاجها عن طريق الساعات البيولوجية. الإيقاعات الدورية، اللي مش مجرد استجابات للإشارات الدورية الخارجية، اتوثقت لمعظم الكائنات الحية، ومنها الخاصة بالبكتيريا والفطريات والنباتات والحيوانات. الساعات البيولوجية هي متذبذبات ذاتية بتشتغل لمدة فيها دورات ورا بعض حتى لو مفيش مؤثرات خارجية.
mt: Many of the rhythms that are detected in physiology and behavior are based to a large extent on the presence of self-sustained oscillations and their production by biological clocks. Rhythms, which are not just responses to external periodic stimuli, have been documented in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustained oscillations that last for a period of time even if there are no external influences.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: "السكان هما مجموعة كائنات حية نوعها واحد وبتعيش في منطقة جغرافية متحددة. لما يكون جميع الأفراد في فئة سكانية متشابهين حوالين سمة ظاهرية معينة، الأفراد دول بنسميهم ""أحاديو الشكل"". لما الأفراد بيبينوا شوية متغيرات لسمة محددة، هما بيقوا متعددي الأشكال."
mt: "A population is a group of individuals of the same kind living in a particular geographical area. If all individuals in a population are uniform with respect to a particular trait, they are called "uniformly shaped". If individuals exhibit some variation in a particular trait, they are called "multiforms". "
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: السياحة الطبيعية بتجذب الناس المهتمين أنهم يزوروا المناطق الطبيعيّة عشان يتمتعوا بالمناظر، ومنها الحياة البريّة النباتيّة والحيوانيّة. الأمثلة على الأنشطة اللي ممكن القيام بيها في الموقع بيبقى من بينها الصيد وصيد الأسماك والتصوير ومشاهدة الطيور وزيارة الحدائق ودراسة المعلومات عن النظام البيئي. من الأمثلة الزيارة والتصوير والتعرف على انسان الغاب في بورنيو.
mt: Natural tourism attracts people who are interested in visiting natural areas to enjoy the scenery, and from it the wild plant and animal life. Examples of activities that can be done on site include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting gardens, and studying information about the environment. Examples include visiting and photographing orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: الناس بيمشوا من المدن الصغيرة في عربياتهم في كل صباح عشان يروحوا لأماكن عملهم وبيقابلهم في الطريق الناس التانيين اللي بيشتغلوا في المكان اللي سابوه لسه دلوقتي. وفي وسيلة النقل اللي فيها حيوية دي، كل واحد يدعم ويرتبط بمنظومة نقل أساسها العربيات الخاصة. العلم  دلوقتى بيشير إلى أن الاقتصاد  العظيم ده المعتمد على الكربون خرج الغلاف الجوي من حالته المستقرة،  و اللي دعم التطور البشري على مدى المليونين سنة  اللي عدت.
mt: People drive from small towns in their cars every morning to go to their jobs and meet other people who work in the place they left behind. In the transportation system that has life, each one supports and connects to a carbon-based economy that has left the atmosphere in an unstable state, and which has supported human development over the past millions of years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: الذرة ممكن نعتبرها واحدة من وحدات البناء الأساسية اللي موجودة في كل المواد. دا كيان معقد أوي بيتكون زي ما بيقول نموذج بهر البسيط من نواة مركزية بادور حواليها إلكترونات، بتشبه إلى حد ما الكواكب اللي بتدور حول الشمس، بص الشكل 1.1. النواة بتتكون من جسيمين هما النيوترونات والبروتونات. البروتونات شحنتها الكهربية موجبة، بس النيوترونات ملهاش شحنة، والإلكترونات شحنتها سالبة.
mt: 1.1: A simplified model of the atom, with a central nucleus orbited by electrons. The nucleus is made of neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive charge, while neutrons have no charge, and electrons have a negative charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: جميعُ أجهزة الكمبيوتر اللي بتستخدم دلوقتي افتراضي بتعتمد على معالجة المعلومات المشفرة في شكل أرقام ثنائية. ممكن يكون للرقم الثنائي قيمة واحدة بس من قيمتين، ٠ أو ١، والأرقامدي بيتقال عليها أرقام ثنائية - أو بتات، لو استعملنا لغة الكمبيوتر.
mt: All computers currently use default processing of encrypted information in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one value but from two values, 0 or 1, and binary numbers are called bits if we use computer language.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: جميعُ أجهزة الكمبيوتر اللي بتستخدم دلوقتي افتراضي بتعتمد على معالجة المعلومات المشفرة في شكل أرقام ثنائية. ممكن يكون للرقم الثنائي قيمة واحدة بس من قيمتين، ٠ أو ١، والأرقامدي بيتقال عليها أرقام ثنائية - أو بتات، لو استعملنا لغة الكمبيوتر.

src: "المدونات ممكن تساعد في تحسين الكتابة بتاعة الطلبة. وفي الوقت اللي بيبدأ فيه الطلبة غالبًا تجربتهم في المدونات بنحو وإملا مش مظبوطة، لكن وجود الجمهور بيغير كل ده. وبما أن الطلاب هما أكتر جمهور بينتقد في أوقات كتير، فبيسعى كاتب المدونة إنه يحسن الكتابة عشان ميتعرضش للانتقاد. المدونات كمان ""ترغم الطّلاب أنهم يكونوا أذكية مع العالم اللي حواليهم"". فيه دافع لتغذية اهتمام الجمهور ودا بيخلي الطلاب يكونوا بارعين ومفيدين (Toto، 2004). التدوين هو أداة بتخلى الناس تتعاون وتشجع الطلبة أنهم يستمروا في التعليم حتى بعد اليوم الدراسي العادي. الإستعمال الصح للمدونات بيخلى الطلبة  أكترتحليل ونقد من خلال استجابتهم الفعالة لمواد الإنترنت، وتحديد موقفهم من  كتابات  التانيين ،  و كمان عرضهم لوجهات نظرهم الخاصة  بخصوص مواضيع معينة (أورافيك ، 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can help improve student writing. At the time when students typically begin their blogging experience, their writing is often unpolished, but the presence of an audience changes all that. Because students are the most critical audience at times, the blogger is motivated to improve his or her writing in order to avoid criticism. Blogs also ""force students to be intelligent with the world around them."" There is a drive to feed the audience's interest and this makes students more creative and productive (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that allows people to collaborate and encourages students to continue learning after the regular school day. Proper use of blogs allows students to be more analytical and critical through their effective responses to Internet materials, to identify their position on the writings of others, and to present their own views on particular topics (Orrick, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: بيشجع الاتصال غير المستقر أننا نخصص الوقت عشان نتأمل ونتفاعل مع الناس التانية. يساعد الطلاب أنهم يشتغلوا بحسب سرعتهم الخاصة وأنهم يتحكموا في المعلومات التعليمية. زيادة على كده، فيه قيود زمنية أقل مع إمكانية تحديد ساعات عمل مرنة. (بريمر، 1998) استعمال الإنترنت والشبكة العنكبوتية العالمية بيوفر للمتعلمين أنهم يوصلوا للمعلومات في أي وقت. الطلاب ممكن بردو يبعتوا أسئلة للمدرسين في أي وقت من اليوم ويتوقعوا إجابات سريعة بشكل معقول، بدل ما ينتظروا حتى الاجتماع التالي اللي وش لوش.
mt: Unstable connections encourage us to allocate time to reflect and interact with others. Students are able to work at their own pace and control the educational information. In addition, there are fewer time constraints with the ability to set flexible working hours. (Pimmer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web provides learners with access to information at any time. Students can also send questions to teachers at any time of the day and expect reasonable quick answers, instead of waiting until the next meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: القلعة التقليدية من العصور الوسطى زودت الخيال من مدة طويلة، وكونت صور المبارزات والولائم وفروسية الملك آرثر. حتى لو كنت واقف وسط آثار قديمة عمرها ألف سنة، سهل أن يجي في بالك أصوات وروايح المعارك اللي انتهت من مدة طويلة، وبتسمع تقريبًا صوت حوافر الخيل على الحصى وتشم رائحة الخوف اللي بيطلع من الزنازين. لكن هل خيالاتنا مبنية على الواقع؟ ليه القلاع اتبنت في الأصل؟ إيه الطريقة اللي استعملوها علشان يصمموها ويبنوها؟
mt: The  medieval castle has long provided fodder for the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts and feasts and the Knights of the Round Table. Even if you're standing amid the ruins of a thousand-year-old fortress, it's easy to conjure up the sounds and smells of battles long past, hearing the hoofbeats on the pebbles and smelling the fear that emanates from the dungeons. But are our imaginings based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? What methods were used to design and build them?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: القلعة التقليدية من العصور الوسطى زودت الخيال من مدة طويلة، وكونت صور المبارزات والولائم وفروسية الملك آرثر. حتى لو كنت واقف وسط آثار قديمة عمرها ألف سنة، سهل أن يجي في بالك أصوات وروايح المعارك اللي انتهت من مدة طويلة، وبتسمع تقريبًا صوت حوافر الخيل على الحصى وتشم رائحة الخوف اللي بيطلع من الزنازين. لكن هل خيالاتنا مبنية على الواقع؟ ليه القلاع اتبنت في الأصل؟ إيه الطريقة اللي استعملوها علشان يصمموها ويبنوها؟

src: "قلعة ""كيربي موكسلو""، بتعد نموذجية عشان الفترة دي، فهي منزل متحصن أكثر منها قلعة حقيقية. النوافذ بتاعتها الكبيرة الثقيلة والأسوار بتاعتها الرقيقة مكانتش تقدر تقاوم هجوم حازم لفترة طويلة. في 1480 ، لما اللورد هاستينجز ابتدا يبنى القلعة، كانت البلاد مسالمة نسبيًا وكان الدفاع مطلوب بس ضد عصابات صغيرة من الحرامية المتجولين."
mt: "Kirby Muxloe Castle, built in the period, is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large, heavy windows and thin walls could not withstand a determined assault for long. In 1480, when Lord Hastings began building the castle, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roaming outlaws."
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: لما نغير المسافة من ربع ميل إلى نص ميل، السرعة بقت أقل أهمية بكتير وبقت القدرة على التحمل أمر ضروري مفيش مفر منه. بالطبع عداء سباقات النصف ميل من الدرجة الأولى، دا رجل ممكن يعمل أي حاجة في أقل من دقيقتين، ولازم يكون عنده قدر معقول من السرعة، ولكن لازم يتم تزويد القدرة على التحمل في كل الأحوال. بعض الناس قي البلد شايفين أن الجري خلال فصل الشتاء، جنب التمارين الرياضية للجزء العلوي من الجسم، هو أفضل إعداد لموسم الجري.
mt: When we change the distance from a quarter mile to a half mile, speed becomes less important and endurance becomes a necessity that cannot be avoided. Of course, a top-level half-miler is a man who can do anything in less than two minutes, but he must have a reasonable amount of speed, and he must be provided with endurance in any case. Some people in the country think that running in the winter, along with upper-body exercise, is the best preparation for a running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: الممارسات الغذائية السليمة مش بس هي اللي بتكون سبب في أداء ممتاز، بس ممكن يكون ليها تأثير كبير على صحة الرياضيين الشباب في العموم. توازن الطاقة الصحي ، والترطيب الفعال ، وفهم الجوانب المختلفة للمكملات الغذائية ممكن يساعد الرياضيين على تحسين أدائهم وزيادة تمتعهم  بالتمارين الرياضية.
mt: Good nutrition practices are not just what it takes to perform well, but it can have a significant impact on the health of young athletes in general. Energy balance, effective hydration, and understanding the different aspects of dietary supplements can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of physical activity.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: جري المسافات المتوسطة رياضة رخيصة إلى حد ما؛ لكن فيه كتير من المفاهيم الخاطئة اللي تخص بعض المعدات المطلوبة عشان يشارك فيها. ممكن تشتري المنتجات زي ما أنت محتاج، بس معظمها هيكون ليه تأثير ضعيف أو مش هيكون له تأثير على الأداء. الرياضيون ممكن يحسوا أنهم بيفضلوا منتج معين حتى لما ميكونش ليه فوايد ممكن نشوفها.
mt: The middle distances are a relatively cheap sport; however, there are many misconceptions about some of the equipment required to participate. You can buy products as you need them, but most of them will have a negligible effect or will not have an effect on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a certain product even when it has no benefits that can be seen.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي بيعتمد على ظاهرة فيزيائية اسمها الرنين المغناطيسي النووي (NMR)، واللي اكتشفوها في تلاتينيات القرن الماضي عن طريق فيليكس بلوخ (من جامعة ستانفورد) وإدوارد بورسيل (من جامعة هارفارد). في الرنين ده، المجالات المغناطيسيّة والموجات الراديوية بتتسبب إنها تحس الذرات إنها ترسل إشارات لاسلكية دقيقة. في سنة 1970، اكتشف رايموند داماديان، وهو طبيب وعالم أبحاث، الأساس اللي اتبنى عليه استخدام التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي على أنه أداة للتشخيص الطبّي. مُنحت براءة اختراع بعد أربع سنين، وهي أول براءة اختراع في العالم في مجال التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي. الدكتورداماديان كمل بناء أول ماسح ضوئي للتصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي للجسم كله سنة ١٩٧٧واللي سماه ""لا يقهر""."
mt: "Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on a phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (of Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University). In NMR, magnetic fields and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the basis for using MRI as a medical diagnostic tool. A patent was granted four years later, the first in the world for MRI. Dr. Damadian completed the first whole-body MRI scanner in 1977, which he named "Indomitable.""
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: الإنسان هو أكتر كائن موهوب ممكن من خلاله قراءة دماغ الناس التانية. دا معناه أننا قادرين إن إحنا نتنبأ بشكل ناجح بمنظور البشر الآخرين أو نواياهم أو إيمانهم أو معرفتهم أو رغبتهم. فهم نوايا التانيين حاجة مهمة جدا من كل المهارات دي بيساعدنا نحلل الغموض اللي ممكن يكون موجود في الأفعال الجسدية . مثلا لو شفت حد بيكسر نافذة عربية، ممكن تفترض إن هدفه يسرق عربية شخص غريب. ممكن نحكم عليه بشكل مختلف لو ضيع مفاتيح عربيته وكانت عربيته هي اللي بيحاول اقتحامها.
mt: Humans are the most gifted creature in which we can read the minds of others. This means that we can successfully predict the perspectives of other people or their intentions, beliefs, knowledge, or desires. Understanding the intentions of others is very important in helping us analyze the ambiguity that may be present in bodily actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you might assume their goal is to steal a car belonging to a stranger. You might judge them differently if they lost their car keys and were trying to break into their own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: رغم أن الذكاء الاصطناعي يشبه إلى حد كبير الخيال العلمي ، إلا أنه فرع مهم جدًا من علوم الكمبيوتربيتعامل مع السلوك والتعلم والتكيف الذكي في الآلة. البحث في الذكاء الاصطناعي هدفه إنك تجعل الآلات تنفذ المهام بطريقة آلية وده بيحتاج طريقة ذكية الأمثلة من ضمنها التحكم والتخطيط ووضع الجداول والقدرة على الإجابة على تشخيصات الزبائن وأسئلتهم، وكمان ممكن من خلاله تتعرف على خط اليد والصوت والوجه. الحاجات دي بقت مجالات منفصلة بتركز على توفير حلول لمشاكل الحياة الحقيقية نظام الذكاء الاصطناعي بيستخدموه دلوقتي في حقول الاقتصاد، والطب، والهندسة، والجيش، واستخدموه بردو عشان يبنوا مجموعة تطبيقات برمجية على الحواسب المنزلية وألعاب الفيديو.
mt: Although artificial intelligence is similar to science fiction, it is an important branch of computer science that deals with intelligent behavior, learning, and adaptation in machines. Research in artificial intelligence aims to make machines perform tasks that would normally require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, and decision-making. These tasks are often used in real-life applications in fields such as economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, and are also used to build software applications and video games for home computers.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: أنماط التفكير التجميعي هي أساليب بيستعملوها عشان حل المشاكل وبتجمع أفكار أو مجالات مختلفة عشان تلاقي حل. العقلية دي بتركز على السرعة والمنطق والدقة وكمان على تحديد الحقائق وإعادة تطبيق التقنيات الموجودة وجمع المعلومات. العامل الأهم في طريقة التفكير دى هو:مافيش غير إجابة واحدة صح. متفكرش غير في إجابتين، صح او غلط. هذا النوع من التفكير بيرتبط بعلم معين أو إجراءات قياسية. الأشخاص اللي بيفكروا كده عندهم تفكير منطقي وهما قادرين على حفظ الأنماط وحل المشاكل والعمل على الاختبارات العلمية.
mt: Problem solving is a method of thinking that involves combining ideas or fields to find a solution. This method focuses on speed, logic, and accuracy as well as identifying facts and reapplying existing techniques and gathering information. The most important factor in this method of thinking is: there is only one correct answer. A thinker is not thinking of two answers, correct or incorrect. This type of thinking is associated with a specific field of study or standard procedures. People who think this way have logical thinking and are able to retain patterns and solve problems and work on scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: استعمال تسجيلات الفيديو ده اتسبب في اكتشافات مهمة في مجال تفسير التعابير الدقيقة للوش، وهي حركات للوش بتستمر لأجزاء قليلة من الثانية. ويدعى بالذات أن المرء ممكن يكتشف إذا كان الشخص بيكذب ولا عن طريق أنه يفسر التعبيرات الدقيقة بطريقة صحيحة. أوليفر ساكس قال في ورقته أن خطاب الرئيس بيقول أن الأشخاص اللي مش بيقدروا يفهموا الكلام بسبب تلف الدماغ بيكونوا قادرين أنهم يقيموا الأخلاص بمصداقية كبيرة. هو بيطرح فكرة أن القدرات دي في تحليل السلوك البشري بتكون متشاركة مع بعض الحيوانات زي الكلاب الأليفة.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the field of interpreting subtle micro-expressions, which are facial expressions that last for fractions of a second. In particular, it has been found that one can detect whether a person is lying or not by correctly interpreting subtle expressions. Oliver Sacks said in his paper that the President's speech implies that people who are unable to understand language due to brain damage are able to assess sincerity with great integrity. He suggests that these abilities in human behavioral analysis are shared with some animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: اتغيرت طريقة الوصول للمعرفة والتعليم زي ما قولنا فوق، ولقينا أن المعدل الأساسي للوصول للمعرفة اتغير هو كمان. طريقة أنك تحصل علي المعلومات كانت مختلفة. الضغط مبقاش في التذكر الفردي، لكن القدرة على تذكر النص حصل عليه التركيز الأكبر. وفي الأصل، عصر النهضة دا سبب تغيير كبير في نهج التعلم ونشر المعرفة.
mt: We found that the basic rate of access to knowledge has changed as well. The way you get information was different. The pressure was no longer on individual memory, but the ability to remember the text got the greater focus. Originally, the Renaissance was a major change in the approach to learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: اتغيرت طريقة الوصول للمعرفة والتعليم زي ما قولنا فوق، ولقينا أن المعدل الأساسي للوصول للمعرفة اتغير هو كمان. طريقة أنك تحصل علي المعلومات كانت مختلفة. الضغط مبقاش في التذكر الفردي، لكن القدرة على تذكر النص حصل عليه التركيز الأكبر. وفي الأصل، عصر النهضة دا سبب تغيير كبير في نهج التعلم ونشر المعرفة.
mt: We found that the basic rate of access to knowledge has changed as well. The way you get information was different. The pressure was no longer on individual memory, but the ability to remember the text got the greater focus. Originally, the Renaissance was a major change in the approach to learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "الإنترنت بيجمع بين عناصر التواصل الجماهيري والشخصي. السمات الخاصة  للإنترنت بتؤدي إلى أبعاد إضافية من حيث مفهوم  ""الاستخدامات والفوايد"". مثلاً بعض الناسبيقولوا إن التعلم والتنشئة الاجتماعية على أنها محركات أساسية عشان نستخدم شبكة الإنترنت (جيمس وغيره، 1995). تم التعرف على المشاركة الشخصية والعلاقات المستمرة إنها جوانب تحفيزية جديدة عن طريق إيمي ومكورد (1998) لما درسوا رد فعل الجمهور على مواقع الويب."
mt: "The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions of the concept of "uses and gratifications." For example, some people say that learning and socialization are basic drivers for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). The personal involvement and continuous relationships were identified as new motivational dimensions by Amy and McLeod (1998) when they studied the public reaction to web sites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: الطراز القوطي وصل أقصى حد ليه في فترة ما بين القرنين العاشر أو الحداشر إلى القرن الأربعتاشر. في البداية الهدوم كانت متأثرة أوي بالثقافة البيزنطية في الشرق. ورغم كده، وبسبب بطء قنوات التواصل، ممكن الأوضاع في الغرب تتأخر حوالي 25 إلى 30 سنة. في نهاية العصور الوسطى، أوروبا الغربية بدأت تطور أسلوبها الخاص. واحدة من أكبر التطورات في الوقت ده بسبب الحروب الصليبية بدأ الناس في استخدام الأزرار عشان يربطوا الملابس.
mt: Gothic style reached its peak in the period between the 10th or 11th to the 14th century. In the beginning, the fashions were influenced by Byzantine culture in the east. However, because of slow communication channels, the situation in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest developments at the time was the use of buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: ممكن نبدأ نعيش بشكل في تناسب أكتر مع البيئة، وممكن ننضم للحركة البيئية، وممكن حتى نكون نشطاء عشان تقليل المعاناة المستقبلية بدرجة معينة. دا بالظبط زي علاج الأعراض في حالات كتير. ورغم كده، لو مش عاوزين حل مؤقت بس، لازم أن إحنا ندور على جذر المشكلة وننتهي منها. واضح بشكل كاف أن العالم اتغير كتير عشان التقدم العلمي والفني البشري، والمشاكل بقت أكبر بسبب زيادة السكان ونمط الحياة المترف بتاع الإنسان.
mt: We can start living more in harmony with the environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even be activists to reduce future suffering to some extent. This is exactly like treating symptoms in many cases. However, if we don't want a temporary solution, we need to turn around the root of the problem and end it. It is obvious enough that the world has changed a lot due to human scientific and technological progress, and the problems have become bigger due to the increase in population and the affluent lifestyle of man.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: الموازنة في الطاقة كان نظام حاولت الدول الأوروبية عن طريقه أنها تحافظ على السيادة الوطنية الخاصة بجميع الدول الأوروبية. المفهوم نص على أن جميع الدول الأوروبية يجب أنها تسعى لمنع دولة واحدة من أن تصبح قوية، وبالتالي الحكومات الوطنية غيرت تحالفاتها عشان تحافظ على التوازن. حرب الخلافة الإسبانية كانت الحرب الأولى اللي قضيتها الأساسية ميزان القوة. ده كان تغيير مهم، لأن القوى الأوروبية معدش ليها ذريعة عشان تكون حروب دينية. وهتكون حرب التلاتين عام آخر حرب تتوصف أنها حرب دينية.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system that the European nations tried to use to preserve the national sovereignty of all European nations. The concept was that all European nations should try to prevent one nation from becoming too powerful, and thus the national governments changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war fought primarily by the Balance of Power. This was an important change, because the European powers no longer had a pretext to fight religious wars. The Thirty Years' War was the last war to be described as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: الكنيسة الكاثوليكية، اللي بقت غنية وقوية، كانت تحت نظر سطات التحقيق خلال الفترة دي من التاريخ الأوروبي. الديانة المسيحية ربطت الدول الأوروبية مع بعض لأكثر من ألف سنة مع إنها مختلفة في اللغة والعادة. القوة الشاملة إللي امتلكها كان ليها تأثير على كل الناس من الملك وحتى عامة الناس. من بين المبادئ المسيحية الرئيسية أن الثروة لازم تستخدمها عشان تخفف المعاناة والفقر، وأن الأموال النقدية في الكنيسة موجودة بالذات عشان السبب ده. السلطة المركزية بتاعة الكنيسة كانت في روما لأكثر من ألف سنة والتركيز ده بتاع القوة والفلوس خلى ناس كثير يتساءلوا اذا كانت العقيدة دي بتلاقي المطلوب.
mt: The Catholic Church, which became rich and powerful, was under intense scrutiny during this period of European history. The Christian religion bound European nations together for more than a thousand years despite their differences in language and custom. The church's central power, which was in Rome for more than a thousand years, focused on power and money, causing many people to question whether the doctrine met the need.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: مرعوبين، الملك لويس السادس عشر والملكة ماري أنطوانيت وولادهم الصغيرين (ماري تيريز اللي عندها 11 سنة ولويس تشارلز اللي عنده 4 سنين) وأخت الملك، السيدة إليزابيث، فيستة أكتوبر سنة 1789، اتجبروا أنهم يرجعوا من فرساي إلى باريس عن طريق مجموعة من غوغاء نسوة السوق. رجعوا لباريس في عربة وبيحاوطهم ناس كتير كانوا بيصرخوا ويهتفوا ضد الملك والملكة. مجموعة من الجماهير نجحت إنها تجبر الملك والملكة إنهم يفتحوا نوافذ عربيتهم على آخرها. واحد من اللي في العصابة في وقت معين يشوح برأس واحد من أفراد الحرس الملكي اللي اتقتلوا في فرساي أمام الملكة الخائفة.
mt: 6 October 1789, horrified, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette and their young children (Marie-Thérèse, 11, and Louis-Charles, 4) and the king's sister, Madame Élisabeth, were forced to return from Versailles to Paris by a mob of market women. They returned to Paris in a carriage and were surrounded by many people who were shouting and chanting against the king and queen. A group of the mob succeeded in forcing the king and queen to open the back of their carriage. One of the mob at one point thrust his head through the window of one of the royal guards who had been killed at Versailles in front of the frightened queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: بريطانيا أسرعت أنها تحاصر ألمانيا بحري بعد ما ظهرت مناوشات ومواجهات. الإستراتيجية أثبتت فاعليتها؛ اتقطع الإمدادات الحيوية العسكرية والمدنية، رغم انتهاك الحصار ده للقانون الدولي المقبول بشكل عام واللي اتكتب واتنسق في شوية اتفاقيات دولية خلال القرنين اللي فاتوا. بريطانيا حطت لغم في المياه الدولية عشان تمنع أي سفينة من دخول مناطق كاملة من المحيطات، ودا أمر بيهدد حتى السفن المحايدة. عشان فيه استجابة محدودة للتتكتيك ده، توقعت ألمانيا رد مشابه على حرب الغواصات غير المقيدة الخاصة بها.
mt: Britain quickly announced it was blockading Germany by sea after clashes and confrontations appeared. The strategy proved effective; vital military and civilian supplies were cut off, despite the breach of this blockade by international law generally accepted and written and coordinated in several international agreements during the past two centuries. Britain laid a mine in international waters to prevent any ship from entering entire areas of the oceans, a move that threatens even neutral ships. In response to this tactic, Germany was expected to take a similar action on its own unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: سبحان أمريكا وحدها فيها حوالي 400,000 حالة متصابه بمرض التصلب المتعدد (ت م) ودا بيخليه أكتر مرض عصبي منتشر بين الشباب والبالغين اللي أعمارهم متوسطة. مرض التصلب العصبي المتعدد هو عبارة عن مرض بيصيب الجهاز العصبي المركزي اللي بيتكون من الدماغ والحبل الشوكي والعصب البصري. الأبحاث بينت أن إمكانية إصابة الستات بمرض التصلب المتعدد أكبر مرتين من الرجالة.
mt: 400,000 Americans have multiple sclerosis, making it the most common disabling neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. Multiple sclerosis is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves. Research has shown that women are twice as likely as men to develop multiple sclerosis.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: الدراسة أن الاكتئاب، والخوف والكوارث بيتوسطوا العلاقة بين الألم والعجز عند اللي بيعانوا من آلام أسفل الظهر. بس آثار الكارثة، والاكتئاب والخوف مكنوش شرط في جلسات نشاط بدني منتظمة كل أسبوع. إحتاج  المشاركين فى النشاط العادى لدعم اكبر من ناحية التصور السلبي للألم علشان يعرفوا يميزوا الفروق بين الألم المزمن والإحساس بعدم الراحة من حركة الجسم العادية.
mt: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophizing were associated with pain and disability in those with low back pain. However, catastrophizing, depression and fear were not required in weekly physical activity sessions. Participants in the usual activity needed more support in terms of negative pain beliefs to distinguish between chronic pain and the discomfort of normal body movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: رياضة المبارزة الحديثة بتتلعب على عدة مستويات، بدايتها من الطلاب اللي بيدرسوا في الجامعة وبتنهي بمنافسات الاحترافية والأولمبية. بيتم لعب الرياضة عن طريق المبارزة، مبارز واحد ينازل واحد تاني.
mt: Modern fencing is played on several levels, from students studying in university to professional and Olympic competitions. The sport is played by dueling, one fencer against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: التسمم الداخلي ممكن متظهرش عوارضه في وقته. التشخيص الفوري مش ممكن نبنيه لما يظهر أعراض زي التقيؤ واللي هي عامة بشكل كافي. أفضل مؤشر للتسمم في الداخل ممكن يكون وجود حاوية مفتوحة عشان الأدوية أو المواد الكيميائية المنزلية السامة. بص على التيكت عشان تعرف إرشادات الإسعافات الأولية بتاعة السم المحدد.
mt: Internal poisoning may not show its effects immediately. Immediate diagnosis cannot be made when symptoms such as vomiting appear, which are generally common. The best indicator of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container for drugs or household toxic chemicals. See the text for instructions on first aid for the specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: عشان تفحص الضحية، لازم في الأول تمسح مسرح الجريمة عشان تضمن سلامتك. هتحتاج أنك تلاحظ وضعية الضحية وأنك تقرب منه، وأي مؤشرات خطر تلقائية. لو أنت اتأذيت وأنت بتحاول تساعد، فأنت كدا بتساعد أن الأمور تكون سيئة.
mt: To examine the victim, you first need to clear the crime scene to ensure your safety. You need to note the victim's position and approach them, and any obvious hazards. If you are injured while trying to help, you are helping the situation to be bad.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: عشان تفحص الضحية، لازم في الأول تمسح مسرح الجريمة عشان تضمن سلامتك. هتحتاج أنك تلاحظ وضعية الضحية وأنك تقرب منه، وأي مؤشرات خطر تلقائية. لو أنت اتأذيت وأنت بتحاول تساعد، فأنت كدا بتساعد أن الأمور تكون سيئة.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: الآثار الاجتماعية والسياسية كتيرة، زى  استخدام النظام المتري، والانتقال من الحكم المطلق للجمهورية ، والقومية، والاقتناع  بأن الدولة ملك للشعب ومش لزعيم واحد. كمان بعد الثورة، كانت الوظايف سداد مداح للشباب الدكورة ودي كانت فرصة للي عنده حلم اكتر أنه يعدي. الشيء نفسه كان في الجيش لأنه بدل من أن تصنيفات الجيش تكون على الطبقة، دلوقتي بقت بتعتمد على الأعيرة. الثورة الفرنسية أثرت بردو في كتير من أبناء الطبقة العاملة المظلومين هما كمان في البلاد التانية علشان يبدأوا في ثوراتهم.
mt: The social and political effects were significant, such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from absolute monarchy to republic, nationalism, and the belief that the state belongs to the people and not to one leader. After the revolution, the youth debt was repaid and was an opportunity for those who had a dream to do more. The same was true in the army, as the army's classification was no longer based on class, but on merit. The French Revolution also affected many of the oppressed working class in other countries, so they began their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: يشارك الجميع في المجتمع وبيستخدموا أنظمة المواصلات. وبيشتكوا كلهم من أنظمة المواصلات. نادر إنك تسمع في البلاد المتقدمة مستويات متشابهة من الشكاوى حوالين جودة الميه أو الجسور اللي بتقع. أنظمة النقل ليه بتتسبب في الشكاوى دي، وليه بتفشل بشكل يومي؟ هل مهندسي النقل مش أكفاء؟ أو هل في حاجة أكتر أهمية بتحصل؟
mt: Everyone in the community uses and complains about the transportation system. Rarely do you hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges in developed countries. Is the transportation system failing daily because of incompetent engineers? Or is there a more important need that is being met?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: يشارك الجميع في المجتمع وبيستخدموا أنظمة المواصلات. وبيشتكوا كلهم من أنظمة المواصلات. نادر إنك تسمع في البلاد المتقدمة مستويات متشابهة من الشكاوى حوالين جودة الميه أو الجسور اللي بتقع. أنظمة النقل ليه بتتسبب في الشكاوى دي، وليه بتفشل بشكل يومي؟ هل مهندسي النقل مش أكفاء؟ أو هل في حاجة أكتر أهمية بتحصل؟

Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: حركة المرور معناها دراسة حركة السائقين و المركبات الفردية بين نقطتين والتفاعلات اللي بيقوموا بيها ما بين بعضهم. للأسف ، دراسة تدفق حركة المرورصعبة لأن مش ممكن التنبؤ بسلوك السواق بدقة مية بالماية. لحسن الحظ، السواقين دايما بيميلوا أنهم يتصرفوا بعقلانية؛ وعشان كده حركة المرور بتبقى موزونة، ويمكن نمثلها بطريقة تقريبية خالص. عشان توضح تدفق حركة المرور بشكل أفضل، بقي فيه علاقات بين الخصائص الرئيسية الثلاثة: (1) التدفق (2) الكثافة، و (3) السرعة. العلاقات دي بتساعد في تخطيط مرافق الطرق وتصميمها وتشغيلها.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of individual driver and vehicle movements between two points and the interactions they have with each other. Unfortunately, traffic flow is difficult to predict accurately because drivers are not always rational; however, traffic flow is self-regulating, and can be approximated. To better understand traffic flow, there are three main properties: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating roadways.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: تجربة هيرشي و تشيس كانت واحدة من الأدلة المهمة على أن الحمض النووي هو مادة وراثية. هيرشي وتشيس استعمل العاثيات أو الفيروسات عشان يدخل الحمض النوويّ بتاعهم على الجراثيم. عملوا تجربتين عشان يميزوا إذا كانت بتستخدم الحمض النووي لفيروس العاثية باستعمال الفوسفور المشع، ولّا بروتين فيروس العاثية بالكبريت المشع.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the key experiments demonstrating that DNA is the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages to introduce their DNA into bacteria. They performed two experiments to determine whether the phage DNA was labeled with radioactive phosphorus or the phage protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: الطفرات ممكن يكون ليها مجموعة من الآثار المختلفة، بحسب نوع الطفرة، وأهمية قطعة المادة الوراثيّة المتأثرة، ولو كانت الخلايا المتأثرة من خلايا الخط الجرثومي ولا لأ. بس الطفرات في خلايا خط-جرثومي ممكن تنتقل للأطفال ، بينما طفرات في محل ثاني ممكن تسبب موت-خلية أو سرطان.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects, depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic region, and whether the affected cells are stem cells or not. Mutations in stem cells can be passed to children, while mutations in a second site can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: يظهر أن الماعز ادجنت للمرة الأولى من 10 آلاف سنة تقريبا في جبال زاغروس الإيرانية. الثقافات والقبائل القديمة استعملوها علشان يوصلوا بسهولة للحليب والشعر واللحوم والجلود. المعيز الأليفة كانت بتتربى في قطعان بتلف على التلال ومناطق الرعي التانية، وفي الغالب كان بيرعاها رعاة المعيز اللي كانوا أطفال أو مراهقين، زي الراعي المعروف، ولسه طرق الرعي دي مستخدمة لدلوقتي.
mt: Goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Iranian Zagros Mountains. Ancient cultures and tribes used them to easily transport milk, wool, meat, and hides. The tame goats were raised in herds that grazed on hillsides and other grazing areas, and were usually tended by goat herders who were children or teenagers, like the famous shepherd, and these grazing methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: الغولف لعبة بيستخدم فيها اللعيبة العصى عشان يضربوا الكرات عشان يدخلوها في الحفر. في الجولة العادية بيتلعب تمنتاشر حفرة لأن اللاعبين في العادي بيبدأوا من أول حفرة في الملعب لحد الحفرة التمنتاشر. اللاعب اللي يعمل عدد ضربات أقل أو التلويحات بالمضرب عشان يكمل الدورة بيفوز. اللعبة بتتلعب على الحشيش ، الحشيش حوالين الحفرة بيتقص وبيسموه الأخضر.
mt: Golf is a game in which the player uses the club to hit the ball in order to get it into the holes. In the ordinary round, there are 18 holes because the players start from the first hole in the course to the 18th. The player who makes the fewest strokes or the fewest putts to complete the round wins. The game is played on the grass, the grass around the hole is cut and called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: الغولف لعبة بيستخدم فيها اللعيبة العصى عشان يضربوا الكرات عشان يدخلوها في الحفر. في الجولة العادية بيتلعب تمنتاشر حفرة لأن اللاعبين في العادي بيبدأوا من أول حفرة في الملعب لحد الحفرة التمنتاشر. اللاعب اللي يعمل عدد ضربات أقل أو التلويحات بالمضرب عشان يكمل الدورة بيفوز. اللعبة بتتلعب على الحشيش ، الحشيش حوالين الحفرة بيتقص وبيسموه الأخضر.

src: الهدف الرئيسي للعلم هو إنك تعرف الدنيا ماشية إزاي باستعمال نهج علمي. هذه الطريقة في الواقع بترشد معظم البحث العلمي. رغم كده هي مش متفردة في الشأن ده، ويعتبر التجريب والتجربة اختبار يمكن استخدامه عشان نتخلص من واحدة أو أكثر من الفرضيات المحتملة؛ طرح الأسئلة وإجراء الملاحظات يوجه البحث العلمي بردو.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works using a scientific approach. This method in fact guides most scientific research. Despite this, it is not unique in this regard, and the experiment and experience is a test that can be used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses; posing questions and conducting observations directs scientific research as well.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: الهدف الرئيسي للعلم هو إنك تعرف الدنيا ماشية إزاي باستعمال نهج علمي. هذه الطريقة في الواقع بترشد معظم البحث العلمي. رغم كده هي مش متفردة في الشأن ده، ويعتبر التجريب والتجربة اختبار يمكن استخدامه عشان نتخلص من واحدة أو أكثر من الفرضيات المحتملة؛ طرح الأسئلة وإجراء الملاحظات يوجه البحث العلمي بردو.

It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: الأعاصير بتضرب مساحة محدودة أما نقارنها بالعواصف الشديدة التانية، ورغم كده، ممكن تدمر الأخضر واليابس في طريقها. ممكن الأعاصير تقلع الأشجار من جذورها وتمزق الألواح من المباني وتحدف السيارات إلى السماء. أعنف 2% من الأعاصير بتستمر أكتر من تلات ساعات. سرعة الرياح فى العواصف الوحشية دى  بتوصل ل ٤٨٠ كم/الساعة (١٣٣ م/ث؛ ٣٠٠ ميل في الساعة).
mt: Hurricanes only affect a small area, but compared to other storms, they can devastate green and brown. Hurricanes can rip trees from their roots and rip shingles from buildings and flip cars into the sky. Only 2% of hurricanes last more than three hours. Wind speeds in these storms can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: الأعاصير بتضرب مساحة محدودة أما نقارنها بالعواصف الشديدة التانية، ورغم كده، ممكن تدمر الأخضر واليابس في طريقها. ممكن الأعاصير تقلع الأشجار من جذورها وتمزق الألواح من المباني وتحدف السيارات إلى السماء. أعنف 2% من الأعاصير بتستمر أكتر من تلات ساعات. سرعة الرياح فى العواصف الوحشية دى  بتوصل ل ٤٨٠ كم/الساعة (١٣٣ م/ث؛ ٣٠٠ ميل في الساعة).
mt: Hurricanes only affect a small area, but compared to other storms, they can devastate green and brown. Hurricanes can rip trees from their roots and rip shingles from buildings and flip cars into the sky. Only 2% of hurricanes last more than three hours. Wind speeds in these storms can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: البشر كانوا بيصنعوا العدسات وبيستعملوها في التكبير من آلاف السنين. بس أول تلسكوبات فعلية اتصنعت في أوروبا كان في آخر القرن الـ16. التلسكوبات دي متكونة من عدستين عشان تخلي الحاجات البعيدة تبان أقرب وأضخم.
mt: People have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands of years. But the first actual telescopes were invented in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes consisted of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: النبي محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم كان مهتم قوي بالحاجات اللي بتتجاوز هذه الحياة اللي في الدنيا. واتعود يروح غار اسمه بقى حراء فوق جبل النور عشان يتأمل. الغار إللي دخله النبي واللي بقي موجودة في كل عصر بيقدم نفسه على إنه صورة حية للغاية عن ميول النبي محمد الروحية. الكهف موجود على قمة جبل شمال مكة، وهو معزول خالص عن بقية الدنيا. في الحقيقة، مش سهل أبدا إنك تلاقيه حتى لو كنت عارف أنه موجود. فبمجرد دخوله الكهف ، بيكون فى عزلة تامة. مفيش حاجة ممكن تشوفها إلا السماء الصافية الجميلة فوق الجبال الكتيرة المحيطة. ومش ممكن تشوف أو تسمع إلا قليل أوي من الحاجات الداخلية إللي جوه الكهف.
mt: The Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, was very interested in things that go beyond this life in this world. He used to go to a cave called Hira on Mount Nur to contemplate. The cave that the Prophet entered and which remains in every era presents itself as a very vivid image of the Prophet Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. The cave is isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is never easy to find it even if you know it is there. As soon as you enter the cave, you will be completely isolated. You can only see the beautiful sky above the many surrounding mountains. You can only see or hear a few things inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: طرق العربات في إنجلترا اتبنت في وقت يرجع للقرن الستاشر. مع أن عربات القطر القديمة كانت بس ألواحٍ خشبية مرصوصة قبال بعضها، بس أدت الخيول فرصة أنها تسحبها عشان تكون سريعة وأنها كمان تسحب حمولات تقيلة دا لو قارناها مع الطرق التي كانت وقتها واعرة قوي. العوارض المتقاطعة دخلت في الأول خالص لتثبيت القضبان في  مكانها. لكن شوية شوية أدركوا أنهم  لو ركبوا قضيب حديدي فوق المسارات، ده هيخلي كفاءته أحسن. دا بقى عرف شائع، لكن الحديد اتسبب في حدوث التآكل للعجلات الخشبية بتاعت العربات. وفي النهاية، بدلوا العجلات الخشبية بعجلات حديدية. وسنة 1767 دخلوا أول قضبان حديدية كاملة.
mt: Horse-drawn roadways were adopted in England in the 16th century. While early carts were constructed of wooden planks laid side by side, horses provided the advantage of being able to pull them quickly and to pull heavy loads. Cross-ties were originally used to secure the rails in place. However, it was soon realized that if a steel rail was laid across the roadways, this would improve its performance. This became common knowledge, but the steel caused wear to the wooden cart wheels. Eventually, the wooden cart wheels were replaced with steel wheels. In 1767, the first complete steel rails were laid.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: الرومانسية كانت قايمة على عنصر كبير من الحتمية الثقافية بيستمدوها من كتاب زي جوته وفيشت وشليغل. مع سير الحركة الرومانسية، الجغرافيا كانت بتكون الأفراد، ومع الوقت بقي فيه العادات والثقافة اللي ليها علاقة بالجغرافيا دي، وكان هؤلاء، عشان هما في سلام مع مكان المجتمع، أفضل من القوانين اللي اتفرضت بشكل إجباري.
mt: Romanticism was a major element of cultural determinism derived from Goethe, Vico and Schlegel. With the rise of Romanticism, geography was becoming individuals, and over time, the customs and culture associated with this geography remained, and those who were in harmony with their community were better than the laws imposed by force.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "الحتمية التكنولوجية هي مصطلح يشمل الممارسة العملية  على مجموعة واسعة من الأفكار ، تتراوح من الديناميكية التكنولوجية أو الضرورة التكنولوجية إلى وجهة النظر الصارمة اللى بتقول أن مصير الإنسان مصير الإنسان يحدده منطق أساسي يرتبط بالقوانين العلمية ومظهرها في التكنولوجيا. بتشترك معظم تفسيرات الحتمية التكنولوجية في فكرتين عامتين: أن تطور التكنولوجيا نفسها بيتبع مسار بعيد إلى حد كبير عن التأثير الثقافي أو السياسي ، وأن هذه التكنولوجيا بدورها لها ""تأثير""على ثقافة المجتمع المتأصل وغير المشروط اجتماعيًا . مثلاً الواحد ممكن يقول إن موتور العربية بيأدي لتطوير الجسور. تأسيس شبكة طرق بطول البلد ملوش فايدة اقتصادية عشان شوية عربيات بس، عشان كده بيطوروا طرق جديدة عشان يقللوا تكلفة ملكية العربيات. امتلاك العربيات بشكل جماعي بيأدي بردو لارتفاع معدل الحوادث على الطرق، ودا بيتسبب في اختراع أساليب جديدة في الرعاية الصحية عشان علاج الأجسام إللي اتعرضت لضرر."
mt: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of practical ideas, ranging from technological determinism or technological necessity to the strict view that the fate of man is determined by a basic logic that is related to scientific laws and its appearance in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a course that is largely independent of cultural or political influence, and that this technology, in turn, has a "effect" on the culture of the society. For example, one can say that the motor car leads to the development of bridges. The establishment of a road network across the country has no economic benefit for a few cars, so new roads are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Car ownership in turn leads to an increase in road accidents, which in turn leads to the development of new methods of health care to treat bodies exposed to damage.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "علامة ""الوتر لأعلى"" زي حرف الـV وتظهر علامة ""الوتر لأسفل"" زي الدباسة أو مربّع يكون فيه الجانب السفلي مش موجود. علامة أعلى بتبين أنه يجب أننا نبدأ من الطرف وندفع القوس، في وقت علامة أسفل معناها وجوب البدء من نهاية القوس (حيث أن إيدك تمسك القوس) وتسحبه. القوس الفوقانى عادة  بيطلع صوت أنعم ، فى حين ان القوس التحتانى أقوى وشديد شوية. متترددش أنك ترسم العلامات بتاعتك بالقلم الرصاص، لكن افتكر أن العلامات المطبوعة المنحنية موجودة عشان سبب موسيقي، عشان كده لازم يراعوها."
mt: "The 'upbow' sign looks like the letter V and the 'downbow' sign looks like a semicircle or square with the bottom side missing. The top sign means that we should start from the tip and push the bow, while the bottom sign means that we should start from the end of the bow (where your hand is holding the bow) and pull it. The upper bow usually sounds more pleasant, while the lower bow is stronger and a bit more forceful. Don't be afraid to draw your own signs with a pencil, but consider the printed curved signs as musical reasons, so they should be considered."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
