src: تايوان بدأت في طريق العودة في القرن الخمستاشر حيث كتب البحارة الأوروبيين اللي بيعدوا عليها اسم الجزيرة lha Formosa، أو الجزيرة الجميلة. في 1624، شركة الهند الشرقية الهولندية بنت قاعدة في جنوب غرب تايوان وبدأت تغير ممارسات الإنتاج بتاع الحبوب الأصلية وتوظيف العمال الصينيين للعمل في مزارع الأرز والسكر. سنة 1683، جيوش أسرة تشينغ (1644-1912) سيطرت على المناطق الساحلية الغربية والشمالية في تايوان وأعلنت أن تايوان مقاطعة تابعة لإمبراطورية تشينغ سنة 1885. في سنة 1895 وبعد ما اتهزمت في الحرب الصينية اليابانية الأولى بين 1894 و 1895 حكومة تشينغ وقعت معاهدة شيمونوسكي، واللي تنازلت من خلالها عن سيادتها على التايوان لصالح اليابان اللي حكمت الجزيرة لحد سنة 1945.
mt: 17th-century European sailors who charted the island called it Formosa, or "beautiful island." In 1624, the Dutch East India Company built a base in southwestern Taiwan and began changing the island's original grain production and employing Chinese workers in rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the Qing dynasty (1644-1912) army took control of the island's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after being defeated in the First Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895, the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: ده بنسميه  درجة الحموضة  للمادة الكيماوية.  ممكن تعمل مؤشر باستعمال عصير الكرنب الأحمر. لون عصير الملفوف بيتغير على حسب مدى حمضية المادة الكيميائية أو قلويتها. مستوى الأُس الهيدروجيني بيتقاس عن طريق عدد أيونات الهيدروجين (حرف الH في pH) في المادة الكيميائية اللي عاوزين يختبروها. أيونات الهيدروجين هي بروتونات اتنزع منها الإلكترونات (دا لأن ذرات الهيدروجين تتكون من بروتون واحد وإلكترون واحد).
mt: We call this the  acidity  of the chemical.  You can use red cabbage juice as an indicator. The color of the cabbage juice changes depending on the acidity or alkalinity of the chemical. The pH level is measured by the number of hydrogen ions (the H in pH) in the chemical you want to test. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had electrons removed from them (because hydrogen atoms are made up of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: الأسود هي أكتر قطط اجتماعية وبتعيش في مجموعات كبيرة اسمها قطعان. عائلة الأسود فيها من واحد إلى تلات ذكور بالغين، وجنب كده فيه تلاتين أنثى وشبل. في العادي بيكون الإناث قريبين مع بعضهم عشان هم عبارة عن عائلة كبيرة من الأخوات والبنات. قطعان الأسود بتتصرف زى قطعان الدياب أو الكلاب ، واللي بتتشابه كثيرفي سلوكها مع الأسود (لكن مش القطط الكبيرة التانية) وهي كمان فتاكة جدا لفرائسها.
mt: The black panther is the most social of cats and lives in large groups called prides. A pride consists of one to three adult males, and twelve to twenty females and cubs. In the wild, females are close to each other, forming a large family of sisters and daughters. Panther prides behave like lion or dog packs, and are also very dangerous to their prey. They are also very similar to the other large cats, but are much more dangerous.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: من بينها  قطط تانية متوسطة الحجم تتغذى على فريسة متوسطة الحجم تتراوح من أرانب لظباء والغزلان. في نهاية الموضوع فيه قطط صغيرة (من ضمنها القطط الأليفة السائبة) بتاكل الفرائس الصغيرة اللي عددها أكتر زي الحشرات والقوارض والسحالي والطيور. سبب نجاحم كان هو مفهوم المكانة، وظيفة خاصة عشان كل قطة تمنعها من التنافس مع التانيين.
mt: Among them are medium-sized cats that prey on medium-sized prey ranging from rabbits to deer and roe deer. At the end of the story, small cats (including feral cats) eat small prey that outnumber insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. Their success was due to the concept of niche, a particular function that prevents them from competing with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: حيوانات النمر القزم بتحب تاكل الحيوانات الصغيرة، وهي بتصطاد القرود والثعابين والقوارض والطّيور لو عرفت تعمل كده. تقريبا جميع الحيوانات التي بيصطادها النمر القزم أصغر منه في الحجم. العلماء شايفين أن قطط الأصلوت تتعقب وتلاقي حيوانات تاكلها (فريسة) باستخدام حاسة الشم؛ وكمان بتشم أماكن وجودهم في الأرض. ممكن تشوف كويس في الضلمة عن طريق الرؤية الليلية، وأنها تتحرك بشكل خفي بردو. كمان حيوانات النمر القزم بتصطاد فرايسها بالتماشي مع محيطها ثم الانقضاض عليهم.
mt: Dwarf leopards like to eat small animals, and they hunt monkeys, cobras, rodents, and birds if they know how to do so. Almost all the animals that dwarf leopards hunt are smaller than them in size. Scientists have seen that cats of the genus Felis track and meet prey animals using the sense of smell; and they also smell places where they are located on the ground. It can be seen well in the dark by night vision, and they move stealthily. Dwarf leopards also hunt prey in accordance with their environment and then pounce on them.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: عشان هو رياضي متميز، النمر ممكن يتسلق (حتى لو مش كويس) وممكن يعوم وينط لمسافات طويلة ويسحب كمان بقوة قد الإنسان خمس مرات. النمر بيبقى في المجموعة نفسها (جنس النمور) مع الأسود والنمور المرقطة واليغور. والأربعة دول هما الوحيدين اللي ممكن يصدروا صوت زئير. زئير النمر مش زي زئير الأسد كامل الصوت، بس هو أٌقرب أنه يكون زي الصياح بكلمات غاضبة.
mt: Because it is a superb athlete, the leopard can climb (even if it is not very good), swim and run long distances and pull five times the strength of a man. The leopard remains in the same group (leopard genus) with the black panther, the jaguar and the tiger. The four countries are the only ones that can produce a roar. The leopard's roar is not like the roar of the lion completely, but it is closer to the roar of angry words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: الخلية هي أصغر شيء في البنية والوظيفة في الحاجات الحية (الحاجات). كلمة الخلية متاخدة أساسًا من الأصل اللاتيني cella اللي معناها أوضة صغيرة. لو حطيت كائنات حية تحت المجهر، هتلاحظ أنها متكونة من مربعات أو كرات صغيرة. روبرت هوك وهو عالم أحياء من إنجلترا شاف مربعاتٍ صغيرة في الفلين باستعمال المجهر. كان أول شخص ممكن يلاحظ الخلايا الميتة، ودي كانت بتشبه الغرف
mt: A cell is the smallest unit of life (living things). The word cell is derived from the Latin word cella, meaning small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or spheres. Robert Hooke was an English biologist who saw small squares in cork using a microscope. He was the first person to observe dead cells, and they resembled rooms.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: تتكون الحيوانات من خلايا كتير. وهما بيأكلوا المواد ويهضموها جواهم. وغالبية الحيوانات بتعرف تتحرك. الحيوانات بس اللي ليها أدمغة (مع إن كل الحيوانات مفيهاش أدمغة زي قنديل البحر مفهوش دماغ). الحيوانات بتعيش في الدنيا كلها، وبيحفروا في الأرض ويسبحوا في المحيطات ويطيروا في السماء.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat and break down food with their bodies. Most animals can move. Animals live on Earth, and dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: تتكون الحيوانات من خلايا كتير. وهما بيأكلوا المواد ويهضموها جواهم. وغالبية الحيوانات بتعرف تتحرك. الحيوانات بس اللي ليها أدمغة (مع إن كل الحيوانات مفيهاش أدمغة زي قنديل البحر مفهوش دماغ). الحيوانات بتعيش في الدنيا كلها، وبيحفروا في الأرض ويسبحوا في المحيطات ويطيروا في السماء.

src: النباتات بتنتج الأكسجين اللي يتنفسه البشر، ويمتصوا ثاني أكسيد الكربون إللي بيسبوه (أي الزفير). النباتات بتصنع طعامها من الشمس عن طريق التمثيل الضوئي وبيوفروا كمان الضل. بنبني بيوتنا من النباتات وبنصنع الملابس من النباتات ، ومعظم الأكل اللي بناكله من النباتات. من غير النباتات متقدرش الحيوانات تعيش.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that humans breathe, and absorb carbon dioxide that they exhale (i.e. breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun through photosynthesis and also provide cellulose. We build our houses from plants and make our clothes from plants, and most of the food we eat is from plants. Without plants, animals could not live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: لما بتنفصل مجموعة صغيرة من الكائنات (عدد قليل من السكان) عن المجموعة الرئيسية اللى جم منها (مثلا ، لما بيهاجروا عبر سلسلة جبلية أو نهر ، أولما بيتنقلوا لجزيرة جديدة بحيث ميعرفوش يرجعوا بسهولة ) ، غالبًا ما بيلاقوا نفسهم في بيئة مختلفة عن اللى قبلها. بسبب أن البيئة الجديدة دي فيها موارد ومنافسين مختلفين، المجموعة حديثة العهد دي هتحتاج خواص مختلفة أو سبل تكيف عشان تبقى منافس أقوي لو عملنا مقارنة بالقوة اللي احتاجتها قبل كده. محصلش أي تغيير على السكان الأصليين أبدا، لسه بيحتاجوا لنفس طرق التكيف زي ما عرفنا عنهم. مع مرور الوقت، ولما يبدأ السكان الجدد أنهم يتكيفوا مع بيئتهم الجديدة، بيقل تشابههم مع السكان التانيين بالتدريج. في النهاية، بعد آلاف أو حتى ملايين السنين، المجموعتين هيبقوا مختلفتين لدرجة أن إحنا مش هنقول عليهم نفس النوع. العملية دي اسمها نشوء الأنواع، واللي معناها ببساطة تكوين أجناس جديدة. يعتبر نشوء الأنواع نتيجة حتمية وجزء مهم أوي من التطور.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) separates from the main group from which it came (for example, when they migrate across a mountain range or river, or are transported to a new island where they cannot easily return), they often find themselves in a different environment than before. Because the new environment has different resources and competitors, the new group will need different traits or adaptive strategies in order to remain a strong competitor if we compare the power they needed before. There is never any change in the original population, they still need the same adaptive strategies as we know about them. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they gradually become less similar to the other populations. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two groups will be so different that we will not call them the same species. This process is called speciation, and simply means the creation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable result and an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: لما بتنفصل مجموعة صغيرة من الكائنات (عدد قليل من السكان) عن المجموعة الرئيسية اللى جم منها (مثلا ، لما بيهاجروا عبر سلسلة جبلية أو نهر ، أولما بيتنقلوا لجزيرة جديدة بحيث ميعرفوش يرجعوا بسهولة ) ، غالبًا ما بيلاقوا نفسهم في بيئة مختلفة عن اللى قبلها. بسبب أن البيئة الجديدة دي فيها موارد ومنافسين مختلفين، المجموعة حديثة العهد دي هتحتاج خواص مختلفة أو سبل تكيف عشان تبقى منافس أقوي لو عملنا مقارنة بالقوة اللي احتاجتها قبل كده. محصلش أي تغيير على السكان الأصليين أبدا، لسه بيحتاجوا لنفس طرق التكيف زي ما عرفنا عنهم. مع مرور الوقت، ولما يبدأ السكان الجدد أنهم يتكيفوا مع بيئتهم الجديدة، بيقل تشابههم مع السكان التانيين بالتدريج. في النهاية، بعد آلاف أو حتى ملايين السنين، المجموعتين هيبقوا مختلفتين لدرجة أن إحنا مش هنقول عليهم نفس النوع. العملية دي اسمها نشوء الأنواع، واللي معناها ببساطة تكوين أجناس جديدة. يعتبر نشوء الأنواع نتيجة حتمية وجزء مهم أوي من التطور.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) separates from the main group from which it came (for example, when they migrate across a mountain range or river, or are transported to a new island where they cannot easily return), they often find themselves in a different environment than before. Because the new environment has different resources and competitors, the new group will need different traits or adaptive strategies in order to remain a strong competitor if we compare the power they needed before. There is never any change in the original population, they still need the same adaptive strategies as we know about them. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they gradually become less similar to the other populations. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two groups will be so different that we will not call them the same species. This process is called speciation, and simply means the creation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable result and an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: العضو الأساسي في الجهاز الدوري هو القلب اللي بيضخ الدم. الدم بيمشي بعيد عن القلب في أنابيب اسمها الشرايين و بيرجع للقلب تاني في أنابيب اسمها الأوردة وأنابيب صغيرة اسمها الشعيرات الدموية.
mt: The heart is the main organ of the circulatory system. Blood moves away from the heart in vessels called arteries and returns to the heart again in vessels called veins and small vessels called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: كانت الحشرات أول حيوانات بتطير في الهوا. ساعدتهم قدرتهم على الطيران على الهروب من الأعداء بسهولة أكبر والوصول للأكل والأزواج بكفاءة  أكبر. معظم الحشرات عندها ميزة إنها بتطوي أجنحتها للخلف بطولِ الجسد. دا بيديهم مجموعة أكبر من الأماكن الصغيرة عشان يختفوا من الحيوانات المفترسة. النهاردة ، الحشرات الوحدية اللي ما بتقدرش تتني جنحانها لوراء هو ذباب التنين و ذباب مايو.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helped them escape predators more easily and reach food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the ability to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a larger range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the single-winged insects that cannot fold their wings back are dragonflies and mayflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: كتير من علماء الحفريات النهاردة واثقين أن مجموعة واحدة من الديناصورات نجت و عايشة اليوم.  احنا بنسميهم طيور. كتير مبيفكروش فيها إنها ديناصورات عشان ليها ريش وممكن تطير. لكن فيه حاجات كتير عن الطيور اللي لسه شبه الديناصورات. عندهم أقدام ليها طبقات حماية خارجية ومخالب، وتضع البيض، وتمشي على رجليها الخلفية زي التيرانوصور.
mt: Many paleontologists today are confident that one group of dinosaurs survived and are still living. We call them birds. Many people argue that they are dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are many things about birds that are still like dinosaurs. They have external protective layers and claws, lay eggs, and walk on their hind legs like the tyrannosaur.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: طحنت أسنان الترايسراتوبس ورق الشجر وكمان الفروع والجذور الناشفة جدًا. بعض العلماء شايفين أن الترايسراتوبس كانت بتاكل سيكاسيات، ودي نوع من النباتات إللي كان منتشر في العصر الطباشيري. النباتات دي بتشبه شجرة نخيل صغيرة لها تاج من الأوراق الحادة والشايكة. الترايسراتوبس كان ممكن يستعمل منقاره القوي عشان يشيل ورق الشجر قبل ما ياكل الجذع. علماء تانيين بيدعوا أن النباتات دي سامة جدا، عشان كده صعب ان الديناصور يكون أكلها، رغم أن الحيوان الكسلان وحيوانات تانية زى البغبغان (من سلالة الديناصورات) تقدر تاكل أوراق  أو فاكهة سامة.
mt: The teeth of the triceratops were used to scrape off the leaves of the tree and also the branches and young roots. Some scientists believe that the triceratops ate cycads, a type of plant that was widespread in the Cretaceous period. These plants were similar to a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, pointed leaves. The triceratops could use its strong beak to remove the leaves before eating the stem. Other scientists have suggested that these plants were very poisonous, so it is unlikely that the triceratops ate them, although the sloth and other animals such as birds (from the dinosaur family) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: منتخب إيطاليا لكرة القدم وكمان المنتخب الألماني لكرة القدم تاني أكتر الفرق في النجاح في الدنيا، وكانوا أبطال كأس العالم لكرة القدم سنة 2006. الرياضات الشعبية منها كرة القدم وكرة السلة وكرة الطائرة وكرة الماء والمبارزة والرجبي، وركوب الدراجات، وهوكي الجليد، وهوكي الانزلاق وسباق السيارات F1. الرياضات الشتوية هي الأكثر شعبية في المناطق الشمالية، اللي بيتنافس فيها الإيطاليين في الألعاب الدولية والأحداث الأولمبية.
mt: Italy's national football team and Germany's national football team are the second most successful teams in the world, having won the FIFA World Cup in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby union, cycling, ice hockey, speed skating and Formula One. Winter sports are more popular in the northern regions, where Italians compete in international competitions and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: لوكسمبورغ عندها تاريخ طويل ولكنها استقلت سنة 1839. الأجزاء الحالية من بلجيكا كانت جزء من لوكسمبورغ قبل كده ولكنها بقت بلجيكية بعد الثورة البلجيكية في تلاتينات القرن التسعتاشر. لوكسمبورج كانت دايما بتحاول تفضل  بلد محايد ، لكن ألمانيا احتلتها  في الحرب العالمية الأولى والتانية. في سنة 1957 لوكسمبورغ بقت عضو مؤسس في المنظمة اللي اسمها النهارده الاتحاد الأوروبي.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but was independent in 1839. The current parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg before that but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to be a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization now called the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: تركيا الأوروبية (تراقيا الشرقية أو روميليا اللي في شبه جزيرة البلقان) هي 3% من مساحة البلد. طول منطقة تركيا بيوصل أكتر من 1600 كيلومتر (1000 ميل) وعرضها 800 كيلومتر (500 ميل) ولها هيئة شبه المستطيل. مساحة تركيا، ومنها بردو البحيرات، تحتل 783,562 كيلومتر مربع (300,948 ميل مربع) ، منها 755,688 كيلومتر مربع (291,773 ميل مربع) في جنوب غرب آسيا و 23,764 كيلومتر مربع (9174 ميل مربع) في أوروبا. منطقة تركيا دي واحدة من أكبر 37 دولة في العالم، وهي حجمها زي دولتي متروبوليتان فرنسا والمملكة المتحدة مع بعض. تركيا متحاوطة بالبحار من جهات تلاتة: بحر إيجه من الغرب ، والبحر الأسود من الشمال والبحر الأبيض المتوسط من الجنوب.
mt: 3% of Turkey's area is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or European Turkey, in the Balkan Peninsula). The length of Turkey extends more than 1600 kilometers (1000 miles) and its width is 800 kilometers (500 miles). The area of Turkey, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometers (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometers (291,773 square miles) are in southwestern Asia and 23,764 square kilometers (9,174 square miles) in Europe. The area of Turkey is one of the 37 largest countries in the world, its size is equal to the metropolitan areas of France and the United Kingdom together. Turkey is bordered by the sea from three sides: the Aegean Sea from the west, the Black Sea from the north and the Mediterranean Sea from the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: عدد سكان مدينة الفاتيكان حوالي 800 شخص. وهي أصغر بلد مستقلة في الدنيا كلها والأقل في عدد السكان. مدينة الفاتيكان بتستخدم اللغةَ الإيطالية أنها تحط تشريعاتها واتصالاتها الرسمية. الإيطالية بردو هي لغة الحياة اليومية اللي بيستخدمها معظم اللي شغالين في البلد، لكن اللاتينيّة بتستحدم في العادي في المراسم الدينية. سكان الفاتيكان كلهم من طايفة الروم الكاثوليك.
mt: Vatican City has a population of about 800 people. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the least populous. Vatican City uses Italian as its official language. Italian is also the language of everyday life used by most of the people working in the country, but Latin is used in the usual religious ceremonies. All residents of the Vatican are members of the Roman Catholic Church.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: أجهزة الكمبيوتر بيستعملوها النهاردة عشان تعالج ملفات الصور والفيديو. الرسوم المتحركة المتقدمة ممكن تتعمل بالحاسب الآلي، وهذا النوع من الرسوم المتحركة بيستخدم بشكل كبير أوي في التلفزيون والأفلام. الموسيقى بتتسجل باستعمال الكمبيوترات الآلية المتطورة، عشان معالجة ومزج الأصوات مع بعضها في الغالب.
mt: Computers are used today to process image and video files. Advanced animation can be done on a computer, and this type of animation is used extensively in television and movies. Music is recorded using advanced computer technology, to process and mix sounds together.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: مدينتي هارابا وموهينجو دارو كان ليهم مرحاض مع آلية تصريف في كل منزل تقريبا مرتبط بنظام صرف صحي متطور. بقايا أنظمة صرف صحي لقوها في منازل مدن مينوان في كريت وسانتوريني في اليونان. كان فيه بردو مراحيض في مصر القديمة وبلاد فارس والصين. في الحضارة الرومانية، كانت المراحيض في أوقات معينة جزء من الحمامات العامة عشان كان الرجال والنساء بيروحوها مع بعض في شركة مختلطة.
mt: 99% of homes in Harappa and Mohenjo Daro had toilets connected to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems were also found in Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, public baths were also used as toilets at certain times, as men and women would go there together in mixed company.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: الشفرة الموجودة على زلاجات الثلج الحديثة بحافة مزدوجة مع سطح مقعر أجوف بينها. تسمح الحافتان بالالتصاق بالثلج بشكل أفضل، حتى عند الميل. لأن الجزء الأسفل من الموس بيميل شوية لناحية أو التانية، بس الطرف اللي بيلمس التلج بيميل هو كمان. دا بيادي لدوران المتزلجين. ولما تميل الزلاجات لليمين، المتزلج هيروح لليمين، ولما تروح للشمال، المتزلج هيروح للشمال.
mt: The code on modern snowmobiles with a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow better attachment to the snow, even at an angle. Because the bottom of the snow is slightly tilted to the left or right, but the part that touches the snow is also tilted. This allows the skiers to rotate. When the snowmobiles tilt to the right, the skier will go to the right, and when they tilt to the north, the skier will go to the north.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "عشان ترجع لمستوى الطاقة اللي فات، يجب أن هما يتخلصوا من الطاقة الإضافية اللي جابوها من الضوء. بيعملوا ده بإرسال جسيم ضوئي صغير اسمه ""الفوتون"". العلماء بيسموا العملية دى ""انبعاث إشعاعي محفز"" لأن الذرات بيحفزها الضوء الساطع وتبعث فوتونات من الضوء، والضوء هو نوع من الإشعاع. الصورة المعروضة التانية بتبين الذرات لما تنبعث منها الفوتونات. وأكيد بتكون الفوتونات في الحقيقة أصغر بكتير من اللي موجودة في الصورة. الفوتونات أصغر كمان من مكونات الذرات!"
mt: "To return to the energy level they started with, they must get rid of the extra energy they gained from the light. They do this by emitting a small light particle called a "photon". Scientists call this process "stimulated emission" because the light shines on the atoms and causes them to emit photons of light, and light is a type of radiation. The second image shows the atoms when they emit photons. The photons are actually much smaller than what is shown in the image. The photons are also smaller than the atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: بعد ما عدا أكتر من مية ساعة شغل، اتحرق الفتيل اللي في اللمبة في الآخر، واللمبة الكهربية مش بتشتغل بعد كده. لازم تغيراللمبة بعد كده . مهم تاخد بالك و انت بتغيراللمبة. في بداية الموضوع لازم تطفي مفتاح المصباح أو تفصل الكابل. دا بسبب أن الكهرباء المتدفقة إلى المقبس إللي هو الجزء المعدني من المصباح ممكن تصيبك بصدمة كهربائية شديدة لو لمست الجزء الداخلي من المقبس أو القاعدة المعدنية للمصباح وهو لسه جزئي في المقبس.
mt: After more than 1000 hours of use, the filament in the bulb burned out, and the light bulb no longer works. You need to change the bulb now. Be careful when you change the bulb. First, turn off the light switch or disconnect the power cord. This is because the electric current flowing to the socket, which is the metal part of the light bulb, can cause a severe electric shock if you touch the internal part of the socket or the metal base of the light bulb, which is easily accessible in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: القنبلة الانشطارية بتعمل على أساس أنها تجمع الطاقة عشان تكون نواة مليانة بالبروتونات والنيوترونات. مثل أنك تدحرج عربية ثقيلة أعلى تل. النواة بتنشق مرة أخرى وينطلق جزء من الطاقة دي. بعض الذرات بيبقى فيها نوى غير مستقرّة ودا معناه أنها بتميل أنها تتفكك مع حركة بسيطة أو بدونها.
mt: A fission bomb works by concentrating energy to create a supercritical mass of protons and neutrons. Imagine a heavy truck rolling down a hill. The nucleus explodes again and some of the energy is released. Some of the atoms remain in an unstable state, meaning they are likely to decay with a small or no movement.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: لما تتصل بشخص ما على بعد آلاف الأميال، فإنت بتستخدم قمر صناعي. القمر الصناعي بالفضاء بيستقبل المكالمة وبيعكسها في نفس اللحظة تقريبا. القمر الصناعي إلى الفضاء اتبعت عن طريق صاروخ. العلماء بيستخدموا التلسكوبات في الفضاء عشان الغلاف الجوي لكوكب الأرض بيشوه بعض الضوء والرؤية. الأمر عاوز صاروخ عملاق طوله أكتر من 100 قدم عشان يثبتوا قمر اصطناعي أو منظار في الفضاء.
mt: When you call someone thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite receives the call and reflects it back almost instantaneously. The satellite is launched by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space to avoid the Earth's atmosphere distorting some light and vision. The process requires a massive rocket over 100 feet long to place a man-made satellite or telescope in space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: الوقت شيء بيحاوطنا وبيأثر على كل حاجة بنعملها إلا أنه صعب على الفهم. علماء الدين والفلسفة والعلوم درسوا الوقت لآلاف السنين. احنا بنختبر الوقت كسلسلة من الأحداث اللي بتنتقل من المستقبل إلى الماضي عبر الحاضر. الوقت برده  هو ازاى نقارن مدة (طول) الأحداث. ممكن تميز بنفسك أن الوقت يمر عن طريق رصد عملية تكرار لحدث دوري، وهو الحدث اللي بيحصل باستمرار وبشكل منتظم.
mt: Time is something that binds us and affects everything we do, but it is difficult to understand. Religious scholars, philosophers, and scientists have studied time for thousands of years. We measure time as a sequence of events that pass from the future to the past through the present. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can tell time by observing the repetition of a recurring event, one that happens continuously and regularly.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: شيء تقليدي، وريث العرش كان بيروح علطول الجيش بعد إنهاء المدرسة. بس تشارلز حضر الجامعة في كلية ترينتي في كامبردج ودرس الأنتروبولوجيا و علم الآثار والتاريخ بعد كده. وخد 2:2 (المرتبة الدنيا الثانية). الأمير تشارلز كان هو أول فرد في العيلة الملكية في بريطانيا يكون معاه شهادة علمية.
mt: A traditional rite of passage, the heir to the throne was leaving the army after finishing school. But Charles attended university at Trinity College, Cambridge, studying anthropology, archaeology and history afterwards. He got 2:2 (the lowest second class). Prince Charles was the first member of the British royal family to have a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: بعد ما قام دانلو بالغزو كانت فيه فترة طويلة من السلام والهدوء في إنجلترا. رغم كده، في سنة 991 اتواجهت إيذلريد عن طريق أسطول الفايكينغ الكبير منذ قرن الغوثروم القديمة خالص. قائد الاسطول ده هو أولاف تريغفاسون، وهو نرويجي عاوز يرجع بلاده من السيطرة الدنماركية. بعد الهزائم العسكرية اللي كانت في الأول، عرف إثيلريد أنه يتفق مع أولاف، اللي جه للنرويج عشان يسيطر على مملكته بدرجات مختلفة من النجاح.
mt: After Danes' invasion, there was a long period of peace and quiet in England. However, in 991, Eadred was faced by Olaf Tryggvason's large Viking fleet for the first time in a century. The fleet's commander was Olaf Tryggvason, a Norwegian who wanted to return his homeland from Danish control. After initial military defeats, Eadred agreed to Olaf's terms, which varied in success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "كانت الثقافة الألمانية ليها تأثير كبير في شمال إستونيا حوالي القرن الخمستاشر. بعض الرهبان الألمان كانوا عاوزين يقربوا السكان الأصليين من الإله، عشان كده اخترعوا اللغة الحرفية الإستونية. اعتمد على الأبجدية الألمانية واتضاف حرف واحد هو ""Õ/õ"". ومع مرور الزمن اندمجت كتير من الكلمات اللي اتاخدت من الألماني ودا حصل في بداية حركة التنوير."
mt: "German culture had a significant impact on northern Estonia in the 16th century. Some German monks wanted to bring the local people closer to God, so they invented the Estonian written language. It was based on the German alphabet and one letter was added, the letter ""Õ/õ"". Over time, many words that were borrowed from German were assimilated, and this happened at the beginning of the Enlightenment."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: التقديرات بتختلف بالنسبة لعدد الناس اللي بيتكلموا اللغة الهندية. والتقديرات بتشير إلى أن تكون بين تاني و رابع أكتر اللغات المنتشرة في الدنيا. عدد أصحاب اللغة الأم بيعتمد أنهم بيحسبوا متحدثي اللهجات اللي بترتبط بها من عدمه. التقديرات مبينة أن فيه ما بين ٣٤٠ إلى ٥٠٠ مليون متحدث وممكن يوصلوا ل ٨٠٠ مليون شخص يفهموا اللغة. الهندية والأردية بيتشابهوا في المفردات بس بيختلفوا في الكتابة؛  في المحادثات اليومية عادة ما بيفهم الناس اللى بيتكلموا اللغتين بعض.
mt: Estimates vary as to the number of people who speak Hindi. Estimates indicate that it is between the second and fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers depends on whether speakers of related dialects are included. Estimates range from 340 to 500 million native speakers and possibly up to 800 million people who understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are mutually intelligible in conversation, but differ in writing; in everyday conversation, people who speak both languages can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "الهانجول هي الأبجدية الوحيدة التي اخترعوها متعمدين في الاستخدام اليومي الشعبي عام 1444 في عهد الملك سيجونج (1418 - 1450). الملك سيجونغ كان الملك الرابع لأسرة جوسون، وكان واحد من الملوك اللي كان ليهم تقدير كبير. الأبجدية الهنجولية اتسمت في البداية اسم ""هانمن جيونجوم""، بمعنى ""الأصوات الصحيحة عشان توجيه الناس""."
mt: "Hangul is the only alphabet invented for everyday popular use in 1443 during the reign of King Sejong (1418-1450). King Sejong was the fourth ruler of the Joseon dynasty, and one of the kings who was highly respected. The Hangul alphabet was originally named ""Hunmin Jeongeum"", meaning ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people."""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: فيه نظريات كتير حواليتم إزاي ظهرت اللغة السنسكريتية، أواحدة منها بترجع لهجرة الآرييون من الغرب إلى الهند اللي جابوا لغتهم معاهم. اللغة السنسكريتية دي لغةٌ قديمةٌ وممكن تقارنها باللغة اللاتينية المستعملة في أوروبا. أقدم كتاب معروفٍ في العالم باللغة السنسكريتية. اتكتب بعد ما اتجمع مجموعة كتابات الأوبنشاد، اللغة السنسكريتية انتهت عشان التسلسل الهرمي. اللغة السنسكريتية لغة معقدة وغنية أوي، وكانت مصدر لكتير من اللغات الهندية الحديثة، زيها زي اللاتينية إللي هي مصدر اللغات الأوروبية زي الفرنسية والإسبانية.
mt: There are many theories about how the Sanskrit language appeared, one of which is that it was brought by the Aryans from the west to India, bringing their language with them. The oldest known book in the Sanskrit language was written after a collection of Upanishads. The Sanskrit language ended when the hierarchical sequence ended. The Sanskrit language is a complex and rich language, and was the source of many modern Indian languages, such as Latin, which is the source of European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: إوزاي هتسحبني جاذبية أيو؟ لو وقفت على سطح أيو، وزنك هيبقى أقل من اللي هو عليه على الأرض. الشخص اللي وزنه 200 رطل (يعني 90 كجم) على الأرض وزنه حوالي 36 رطل (16 كجم) على قمر آيو. عشان كده الجاذبية بتشدك أقل فهمت.
mt: 1. Why do you weigh less on the moon? If you stood on the surface of the moon, your weight would be less than it is on Earth. The person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kilograms) on Earth weighs about 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on the moon. That's why gravity pulls you less, right?
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: سطح القمر بيتكون من الصخور والغبار. والطبقة الخارجية للقمر اسمها القشرة. سمك القشرة بيبلغ حوالي 70 كيلومتر على الجانب القريب و100 كيلومتر على الجانب البعيد. هو أنحف تحت ماريا وأكثر سمك تحت منطقة المرتفعات. ممكن يكون فيه كتير من البحار القمرية في الجانب القريب لأن القشرة سمكها أقل. وكان أسهل للحمم إنها تخرج للسطح.
mt: The Moon's surface is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 kilometers thick on the near side and 100 kilometers thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be many lunar seas on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to come to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "كتير من الناس بيحلموا باليوم اللي ممكن فيه يسافر البشر إلى نجم آخر عشان يستكشفوا عوالم تانية, البعض بيسأل ايه اللي بيحصل في الأماكن دي، وفيه اعتقاد إن الحياة التانية أو الكائنات الفضائية بتعيش على كوكب تاني. بس لو ده حصل، فممكن يكون بعد وقت طويل قوي. بتكون النجوم متوزعة في مساحة كبيرة لدرجة أن فيه تريليونات من الأميال بين النجوم ""اللي جنب بعضها"". ممكن في يوم من الأيام أحفاد أحفادك هيقفوا على قمة عالم فضائي وبسألوا عن أسلافهم القدماء؟"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star to explore other worlds, some ask what is happening in these places, and there is a belief that life or extraterrestrial life lives on another planet. But if this happens, it will be after a long time. The stars are distributed over a large area so that there are trillions of miles between the stars ""which are next to each other"". One day, the descendants of your descendants will stand on the top of a space world and ask about their ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "الشمس معندهاش قشرة  زى الأرض ممكن  تقف عليها. الشمس كلها  بتتكون من غازات ونار وبلازما. سماكة الغاز بتبقى رقيقة لما تبعد عن مركز الشمس. اسم ""الفوتو سفير"" بيطلقوه على الجزء الخارجي اللي متشاف من الشمس لما تبص ليها، والمصطلح ده معناه كرة النور."
mt: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth can stand on. The Sun is entirely made of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas will remain thin as it moves away from the Sun's center. The term 'photosphere' is used to describe the outermost part of the Sun visible to the eye, and the term means ball of light."
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: بعد حوالي ثلاثة آلاف سنة، اكتشف عالم الفلك الإيطالي جاليليو جاليلي سنة ١٦١٠، بمساعدة التلسكوب، أن الزهرة  له مراحل ، تمام زى القمر. تحدث الأوجه لأن الجانب الوحيد من كوكب الزهرة (أو من القمر) اللي بيضئ هو الجانب اللي بيواجه الشمس. مراحل كوكب الزهرة دعمت نظرية كوبرنيكوس بأن الكواكب تدور حول الشمس. بعد ما عدت سنين عالم فلكي إنجليزي اسمه إرميا هوروكس راقب عبور كوكب الزهرة سنة 1639.
mt: After about three thousand years, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei discovered in 1610, with the help of the telescope, that Venus has phases, just like the moon. The phases occur because only the side of the planet (or the moon) that faces the sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that the planets revolve around the sun. After years, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed the transit of Venus in 1639.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: نهر الأمازون هو تاني أطول نهر وأكبر نهر في العالم. فيه ميه أكتر 8 أضعاف من ثاني أكبر نهر في العالم. نهر الأمازون هو كمان أعرض نهر على وجه الأرض، أوقات عرضه بيبقى 6 أميال. 20 في المية من الميه التي بتصب من أنهار الكوكب كله في المحيطات بتيجي من نهر الأمازون سبحان الله. نهر الأمازون الرئيسي طوله 6,387 كم (3,980 ميل). وهو بيجمع المياه إللي جايه من آلاف الأنهار الصغيرة.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river and largest river in the world. It has more water than eight times the second largest river in the world. The Amazon River is also the widest river on the planet, its width is 6 miles. 20% of the water that flows into the world's oceans comes from the Amazon River, praise be to God. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. It collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: نهر الأمازون هو تاني أطول نهر وأكبر نهر في العالم. فيه ميه أكتر 8 أضعاف من ثاني أكبر نهر في العالم. نهر الأمازون هو كمان أعرض نهر على وجه الأرض، أوقات عرضه بيبقى 6 أميال. 20 في المية من الميه التي بتصب من أنهار الكوكب كله في المحيطات بتيجي من نهر الأمازون سبحان الله. نهر الأمازون الرئيسي طوله 6,387 كم (3,980 ميل). وهو بيجمع المياه إللي جايه من آلاف الأنهار الصغيرة.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river and largest river in the world. It has more water than eight times the second largest river in the world. The Amazon River is also the widest river on the planet, its width is 6 miles. 20% of the water that flows into the world's oceans comes from the Amazon River, praise be to God. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. It collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: تمنتاشر في المية من الفنزويليين من غير شغل، ومعظم الموظفين بيشتغلوا في اقتصاد بعيد عن عيون الدولة. تلت الفنزويليين بيشتغلوا في قطاع الخدمات، قريب من ربعهم في الصناعة وخمسهم في الزراعة. النّفط بيعتبروه صناعة مهمة بالنسبة لهم في فنزويلا، لأنها دولة بتعتبر مصدّر صافي ليه رغم أنّ واحد في المية بس اللي بيشتغلوا في صناعة النّفط.
mt: 14% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most workers are in the service sector, close to a quarter in industry and five percent in agriculture. Oil is considered an important industry for them in Venezuela, as a country that is considered a net exporter of oil despite one in five working in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: تمنتاشر في المية من الفنزويليين من غير شغل، ومعظم الموظفين بيشتغلوا في اقتصاد بعيد عن عيون الدولة. تلت الفنزويليين بيشتغلوا في قطاع الخدمات، قريب من ربعهم في الصناعة وخمسهم في الزراعة. النّفط بيعتبروه صناعة مهمة بالنسبة لهم في فنزويلا، لأنها دولة بتعتبر مصدّر صافي ليه رغم أنّ واحد في المية بس اللي بيشتغلوا في صناعة النّفط.

src: ينبعث الضوء والحرارة من النجوم بسبب الطاقة الناتجة عن دمج (أوالتحام) ذرات الهيدروجين مع بعضها لتشكيل عناصر أقل. العلماء شغالين يبنوا مفاعل ممكن ينتج الطاقة بالطريقة نفسها. رغم كده، فهي مشكلة صعب تتحل وهتاخد سنين طويلة قبل ما نشوف بناء مفاعلات اندماج ليها فايدة.
mt: Light and heat are emitted from stars because of the energy released when hydrogen atoms fuse together to form lighter elements. Scientists are working to build a reactor that produces energy in the same way. However, this is a difficult problem to solve and it will take many years before we see the construction of fusion reactors that are useful.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: ينبعث الضوء والحرارة من النجوم بسبب الطاقة الناتجة عن دمج (أوالتحام) ذرات الهيدروجين مع بعضها لتشكيل عناصر أقل. العلماء شغالين يبنوا مفاعل ممكن ينتج الطاقة بالطريقة نفسها. رغم كده، فهي مشكلة صعب تتحل وهتاخد سنين طويلة قبل ما نشوف بناء مفاعلات اندماج ليها فايدة.

src: ممكن للعناصر والمركبات إنها تنتقل من حالة للتانية من غير ما تتغير. النيتروجين كغاز لسه له نفس خصائص النيتروجين السائل. وبتكون الحالة السائلة أكثر كثافة بس الجزيئات زي ما هي ثابتة. والمية مثال تاني. حيث يتكون مركب الماء من ذرتين هيدروجين وذرة أكسجين. يحمل التركيب الجزيئي نفسه سواء كان في حالة غازية أو سايلة أو صلبة. حتى لو اتغيرت حالته الفيزيائية، حالته الكيميائية هتفضل زى ما هي.
mt: Substances and compounds can change from one state to another without changing. Nitrogen gas is the same as liquid nitrogen. Liquid nitrogen is denser but the molecules are the same. Water is another example. The molecular structure is the same whether it is in a gaseous, liquid, or solid state. Even if its physical state changes, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: ممكن للعناصر والمركبات إنها تنتقل من حالة للتانية من غير ما تتغير. النيتروجين كغاز لسه له نفس خصائص النيتروجين السائل. وبتكون الحالة السائلة أكثر كثافة بس الجزيئات زي ما هي ثابتة. والمية مثال تاني. حيث يتكون مركب الماء من ذرتين هيدروجين وذرة أكسجين. يحمل التركيب الجزيئي نفسه سواء كان في حالة غازية أو سايلة أو صلبة. حتى لو اتغيرت حالته الفيزيائية، حالته الكيميائية هتفضل زى ما هي.

src: في وقت حرب الاستقلال، كونت الولايات التلاتاشر في البداية حكومة مركزية ضعيفة، وكان الكونجرس هو المكون الوحيد فيها مع مواد النظام الفيدرالي. الكونجرس كان معندوش أي سلطة يفرض بيها الضرائب، وبسبب أن مكنش موجود سلطة تنفيذية وطنية أو قضائية، كانوا معتمدين على سلطات الدولة اللي كانت في الغالب مش متعاونة خالص، عشان تفرض كل قوانينه. مكنتش كمان عندها سلطة تقدر تتجاوزبيها  قوانين الضرايب والرسوم الجمركية بين  الولايات. تطلبت المواد أن يتوافق عليها من جميع الولابات قبل ما تتعدل و الولايات استهزأت من الحكومة المركزية لدرجة أن ممثليهم في الغالب كانوا غايبين.
mt: During the War of Independence, the Thirteen States initially formed a weak central government, and the Congress was the only institution with federalist principles. Congress had no power to levy taxes, and because there was no national executive or judiciary, they relied on state governments, which were often uncooperative, to enforce their laws. Congress also lacked the power to override state tariffs and customs duties. The Articles required unanimous approval from all states before they could be amended, and state representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "لو شوفتوا فيلم الكنز الوطني، ممكن تحس أن خريطة كنز اتكتبت على ظهر إعلان الاستقلال. بس ده مش صحيح. مع إنه في شيء مكتوب على ظهر الورقة بس مش خريطة لكنز. إعلان الاستقلال اتكتب على ظهره عبارة ""إعلان الاستقلال الأصلي في أربعة يوليو 1776"". وبيظهر النص في أسفل المستند وهو مقلوب. رغم أن كاتب هذا الجزء من النص مش معروف، ولكن احنا عارفين أن المخطوطة الكبيرة (ذات مقاسات 29¾ بوصة × 24½ بوصة) كانت متخزنة مطوية في بداية وجودها. عشان كده، ممكن يكون الرمز يكون إتضاف على إنه تسميه ببساطة خالص."
mt: "If you've seen the movie National Treasure, you might think that the treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. But that's not true. Although something is written on the back of the document, it's not a treasure map. The Declaration of Independence was written on the back of the document, and it appears at the bottom of the document, upside down. Although the author of this part of the text is unknown, we know that the large manuscript (29¾ inches × 24½ inches) was stored folded at the beginning of its existence. So, the symbol may have been added simply as a name."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: في الأيام الأولى من استقلال البلد، خبرة حدايق سنغافورة النباتية نجحت إنها تحول الجزيرة إلى مدينة في الحدائق الاستوائية. في سنة 1981 اختاروا فاندا ميس جوكويم ودي عبارة عن هجين أوركيد على أنها زهرة وطنية للبلاد.
mt: In the early days of independence, Singapore's Horticultural Experience succeeded in turning the island into a city of tropical gardens. In 1981 they chose Vanda Miss Joaquim and Dendrobium as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: رغم أن بنا الأهرامات بالحجر استمر حتى نهاية الدولة القديمة، لكن أهرامات الجيزة مفيش حاجة اتفوقت عليها في الحجم والتميز الفني في بناها. المصريين القدماء في المملكة الحديثة اندهشوا من آثار اللي قبلهم، واللي استمرت أكتر من ألف سنة.
mt: Although the pyramids of Giza were built of stone, they were not the only ones in Egypt. The Old Kingdom lasted for more than a thousand years, and the Egyptians of the New Kingdom were amazed by the monuments of their predecessors.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: حوالي 1.5 مليون من الحيوانات العاشبة بيهاجروا في شهر أكتوبر كل سنة للسهول الموجودة في الجنوب وبيعبروا نهر مارا من التلال الشمالية عشان الأمطار. ونرجع للشمال من الغرب برده عن طريق نهر مارا، بعد ما نزلت الأمطار سيول في شهر أبريل على ما أظن صح. منطقة سيرينجتي فيها حديقة سيرينجتي الوطنية ومنطقة محمية نوجورنوجور ومحمية ماسوا للحيوانات في تنزانيا ومحمية ماساي مارا الوطنية في كينيا.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores migrate in October every year to the savannas in the south and cross the Mara River from the northern hills to graze. We return to the north from the west again through the Mara River, after the rains have flooded in April, I think. Serengeti National Park is in Serengeti, Tanzania, and Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "بعد ما انتهت معركة فرنسا، بدأت ألمانيا أنها تستعد تغزو اللي اسمها جزيرة بريطانيا. ألمانيا سمت الهجوم الاسم السري ""عملية أسد البحر"". والجيش البريطاني خسر معظم أسلحته الثقيلة وإمداداته بعد ما أجلوه من دونكيرك، عشان كده كان ضعيف بدرجة كبيرة. لكن البحرية الملكية لحد دلوقتي أقوى كثير من البحرية الألمانية (""كريغسمارينه"") وكانت تقدر تدمر أي أسطول ممكن يقوم بالغزو، ويجي من القناة الإنجليزية. رغم كده، عدد قليل من السفن بتاعت البحرية الملكية قرب طرق الغزو المحتملة في حين أن الأدميرالات كانوا خايفين أنهم يغرقوا بسبب الهجوم الجوي الألماني."
mt: "After the Battle of France, Germany began preparing to invade the island of Britain. Germany named the operation the "Sea Lion". The British Army lost most of its heavy equipment and supplies after evacuating from Dunkirk, so it was greatly weakened. However, the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine"), and could have sunk any invasion fleet, coming through the English Channel. Nevertheless, only a few ships of the Royal Navy were near the likely invasion routes, while the admirals were afraid of being sunk by the German air force."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "خلونا نبدأ نشرح مخططات إيطاليا. كانت إيطاليا زي ""الأخ الأصغر"" لألمانيا واليابان. كان عندها جيش وبحرية ضعاف مع إنهم بنوا في وقت قريب أربع سفن جديدة قبل الحرب متبدأ على طول. الأهداف الأساسية بتاعت إيطاليا كانت البلدان الأفريقية. وعشان تحتل البلاد دي كان لازم تاخد منصة لإطلاق القوات، عشان القوات تبحر من خلال البحر الأبيض المتوسط وبعد كده أفريقيا. عشان كده ، كان لازم يتخلصوا من القواعد والسفن البريطانية في مصر. بعد الإجراءات مطلبش من المراكب الحربية الإيطالية يعملوا حاجة تاني. الآن بالنسبة لليابان. كانت اليابان بلد جزرية زيها زي بريطانيا."
mt: "Let's start by explaining Italy's plans. Italy was like Germany's "younger brother" and Japan. It had a weak army and navy, but built four new ships just before the war began. Italy's main objectives were African countries. To occupy these countries, they needed a staging area for their forces, which would sail through the Mediterranean Sea and then to Africa. Therefore, they needed to get rid of the British bases and ships in Egypt. After the actions, the Italian warships did nothing else. Now, let's talk about Japan. Japan was an island nation like Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "عمليات الإنزال اللي كانت في اليوم المشهود والمعارك التالية ليه أدت إلى تحرير شمال فرنسا، لكن الجنوب مكنش اتحرر لسه. كانت تحت حكم ""الفيشي"" الفرنسواى. دول كانوا الشعب الفرنسواى اللى صنعوا السلام مع الالمان سنة ١٩٤٠ واتعاونوا مع الغزاة بدل ما يحاربوهم. في خمستاشر أغسطس 1940، غزا الحلفاء جنوب فرنسا، والغزو اتسمى بـ ""عملية دراغون"". في أسبوعين بس، حرر الأمريكيين والقوات الفرنسية الحرة جنوب فرنسا، وكانوا في طريقهم لألمانيا."
mt: "The landings that took place on D-Day and the subsequent battles led to the liberation of northern France, but the south was not yet liberated. It was under the control of the "Vichy" French. They were the French people who made peace with the Germans in 1940 and collaborated with the invaders instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1944, the Allies invaded southern France, and the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon." In two weeks, the Americans and the Free French liberated southern France, and they were on their way to Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: الغواصات هي سفن اتصممت عشان تسافر تحت الماء، والبقاء هناك لفترة طويلة من الزمن. استخدموا الغواصات في الحرب العالمية الأولى والثّانية، وفي الوقت ده كانوا بطيئين أوي وكان نطاق الرماية محدودا جدا. في بداية الحرب، سافروا في عن طريق البحر في الغالب، بس لما بدأ الرادار يتطور وبقي دقيق، اضطرت الغواصات تقوم بعملها تحت الميه عشان متتكشقش. „”الغواصات الألمانية كانوا بيسموها U-Boats وكان الألمان فالحين خالص في توجيه غواصاتهم وتشغيلها. بسبب أن الألمان نجحوا في تصنيع الغواصات، فمكانوش محل ثقة إن يكون عندهم الكتير منها بعد الحرب.
mt: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater for long periods of time. They were used in World War I and World War II, and at the time were slow and had a very limited range of fire. At the beginning of the war, they mostly traveled by sea, but when radar began to develop and become more accurate, submarines were forced to operate underwater to avoid detection. "The German submarines were called U-Boats, and the Germans were very good at directing and operating their submarines. Because the Germans were successful in manufacturing submarines, there is no doubt that they had many of them after the war.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: وفي يوم سبعتاشر سبتمبر سنة 1939، كان الدفاع البولندي انهار بالفعل، وكان الأمل الوحيد هو التراجع وإعادة التنظيم على طول الجسر الروماني. ورغم كده، فالخطط دي بقت قديمة في يوم وليلة، لما دخل أكثر من 800000 جندي من الجيش الأحمر للاتحاد السوفيتي وكوّنوا الجبهتين البيلاروسية والأوكرانية بعد ما غزوا المناطق الشرقية من بولندا ودا انتهاك لمعاهدة ريغا للسلام واتفاقية عدم الاعتداء السوفيتية البولندية والمعاهدات الدولية الأخرى، الثنائية واللي فيها أطراف كتير.
mt: 17 September 1939, the Polish defense had already collapsed, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganize along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were outdated in a day and a night, when more than 800,000 Soviet Red Army soldiers formed the Belorussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland and violating the Riga Peace Treaty and the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact and other bilateral and multilateral treaties with many parties.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: بالنسبة للإيطاليين في شمال أفريقيا الأمور مكنتش ماشية  كويس  من الأول اتقريبا. وفي ظرف أسبوع من إعلان إيطاليا الحرب في عشرة يونيو  ١٩٤٠، استولى هوسارس الحداشر البريطاني على حصن كابوزو في ليبيا. البريطانيين أسروا كبير مهندسي الجيش الإيطالي العاشر وهو الجنرال لاستوتشي في كمينٍ اتنصب ليه في غرب ميناء بردية. في ٢٨ يونيو، المارشال إيتالو بالبو، الحاكم العام لليبيا والوريث المحتمل لموسوليني، اتقتل بنيران صديقة وهو بيهبط في طبرق.
mt: Things were not going well for the Italians in North Africa. Within a week of Italy declaring war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars captured the fortress of Capuzzo in Libya. The British captured the Italian Army's tenth engineer, General Lastucci, in an ambush set for him in the west of the port of Bardia. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the general governor of Libya and the likely heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire as he landed in Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: البوذية التبتية بتعتمد على تعاليم بوذا، بس امتدت من خلال طريق ماهايا للحب وأساليب تانية متاخدة من اليوغا الهندية. من حيث المبدأ ، البوذية التبتية بسيطة جدًا. وهى بتتكون من كونداليني يوجا والتأمل وطريق الحب الشامل. طاقة كونداليني (طاقة التنوير) بتستيقظ عن طريق وقفات اليوجا وتمارين التنفس والترانيم والتخيلات، مع كونداليني يوجا. مركز التأمل التبتي هو بيكون الإله يوجا. من خلال تصور الآلهة المختلفة، قنوات الطاقة بتتنظف، وتنشيط الشاكرا، وخلق وعي عشان التنوير.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but has been extended through the Mahayana path of love and other methods taken from Indian yoga. In principle, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini yoga, meditation and the comprehensive path of love. Kundalini energy (energy of enlightenment) is awakened by yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations, with Kundalini yoga. The Tibetan meditation center is the god Yuga. Through the visualization of different gods, energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated, and awareness is created for enlightenment.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
